text: Cafe blanco is awesome! The staff is very friendly and upbeat. There is a comfy couch and two comfy chairs that I fancy. They play a very nice mix of music there. The coffee is about a dollar cheaper than chain coffee and 100% better. Cheaper, Better, Faster, Stronger... seriously! The large has three shots not two and the when you add the whip cream you come up with a coffee that you have to savor! This is my favorite coffee shop in Phoenix. Mucho Recomendo!

I'm writing this review as I sit in Lola, sipping on a cappuccino, so you know they have free WIFI.  This review isn't about the WIFI. You also know they have coffee, since "Coffee" is in their name, and it's a caf√©.  This review isn't about that either.

This is about the quiche.

Actually, it's about all the pastries, since they're all made by the same unfathomably talented pastry chef, but it's the quiche that, every time I have it, makes me wonder, "If this is quiche, what's that stuff I ate every other time I ordered quiche?"  It's light. Just ... just so, so light, and fluffy. The crust is crispy and light and buttery. And it costs far less than inferior quiche at other places (about $4, I think).

But the five stars I gave it aren't just for the quiche, or the rest of the amazing pastries.  This place just does everything right: the location is in a beautiful, historic location; they have a terrific selection of loose-leaf tea; the atmosphere is cool, with worn concrete floors, a high ceiling, and vintage furniture; the staff is friendly, and acts like a family; and a vintage Bang & Olufsen stereo playing music that is far too cool for me to identify it.  Oh, and the coffee is great.
Best mocha in town. The Matador is hands down one amazing drink! The vibe is great and food is good as well. Definitely on my rotation now when I'm in the downtown area.

Lola Coffee is definitely my favorite downtown coffee shop.  The service is always quick and friendly, and they always make my drink exactly how I like it without asking.  They just seem to do it right, each and every time.  There's always something delicious waiting for you in the baked good section, and if you're lucky enough to catch the cherry rice pudding, you're luckier than I've been in several months.  The coffee might just be the strongest in town (and it still tastes great) - I've always got the good-shakes for a while after I visit.

Despite living near Fair Trade Cafe for 2 years, this has become MY coffee shop.  

Coffee:
The Matador is a great "signature" drink.  Their lattes are pretty good, if not typically as memorable as Giant Coffee's.  The Americano here is much better than other places nearby, in my experience.

Food:
Holy cow!  The baked goods are Lola are enough to make me skip breakfast and just head here.  I really dig the randomness of never knowing what they will make, and have never been disappointed when I've tried a new variation on something.  

Atmosphere & Service:
The atmosphere and the service are what makes me come here over any other coffee shop near Roosevelt.  Lisa and the rest of the staff have always given me excellent service, even when I show up at the last minute.  Great service, a greeting when I show up, and a personal touch make me feel much more welcome here than at other nearby places.  Plus, the lighting is great; I love to start my day off by grabbing coffee and catching up on the news/twitter from here, and I really dig the "refurbished" or "repurposed" feel to the furnishing here.  The school chairs, the well-worked white table, the door-as-a-menu, the exposed brick, and the great speakers in the corner all give the place a great, lived in, texture.

Shoot, I've mentioned this place 6 times on my blog in the last year (http://www.relevantwit.com/?s=lola).  I'm pretty clear I'm addicted.

I will echo the reviews below. Amazing friendly service. I got the egg white omelet w/ bacon, spinach, & tomatoes. A little over priced but you do get a large portion size. I also got the cafe latte which was very good. I would recommend this to all!

This is a really nice place. Went here for the first time the other afternoon and loved it. Delicious coffee (I got the matador) and nice atmosphere. I would definitely come here to work or read. Great window seating and various styles of indoor seating (low tables, high tables, couches, etc.) Little $ but was worth it if you are looking for a good quality coffee. Will definitely be going back!
Good coffee, sometimes a little burnt. Pastries great.

Lola Coffee is a cute unique place. I loved the fact that this place is pet friendly. I brought my baby pug with me, and we were more than welcomed. The coffee tastes perfect, wonderful blend. Chocolate croissant is a total guilty pleasure.... mmmm. Staff is friendly and helpful.
I am giving 4 stars because parking situation is tough (better to take Uber).

Tea selection leaves more to be desired, but its given in a teapot, which gives it an extra plus :).

The place is super cute, but if you're coming to work, know that there aren't outlets for plugging laptops in

This is the best coffee shop I have been to in Arizona. I normally get the hot caramel latte's! Very good choice if you don't know what get. There is a pretty good amount of space and tables for you to do your work out while drinking your coffee.

First of all, I'm glad that Lola moved in to this space. I miss Calabria, but I'm glad something worthy has taken over this spot that serves delectable things.

Thanks to Chef Danielle (formerly of Sweet Pea Bakery), Lola's baked goods are worth dreaming about. If you ever find macarons (perhaps this is the French spelling?), then you have to purchase one or two because those things are to die for.

I like the ambiance, I like the staff and people who frequent it. It's a good crowd, mostly on their laptops or busy reading their books or newspapers.

Here's my one and only complaint: They don't make their drip coffee hot enough.

I'm a simple gal. I don't ask for those mocha, macchiato, extra foam, skinny-skinny, with drizzle and powder on top kinda drinks. I just want simple brewed coffee with some room for my cream.

The first time I purchased coffee at Lola's, it was served in a cup because I chose to drink it there. And it was already lukewarm, therefore, it was "iced" coffee by the time I had my second sip. The next time, I asked for it in a to-go cup, thinking that the lid might keep the coffee warmer longer. Alas, the drip coffee was lukewarm after my third sip. The last time I was there (3 days ago), I asked for them to put in a to-go cup again and to make it a little hotter than usual. Oh, it was hot alright, but maybe just 2 notches above their usual "warm."

I'm not looking for scalding coffee but just hot enough for me to enjoy hot coffee a little longer while reading the Arts section of the Arizona Republic (and there's really not much content in that section).

Can't a girl ever get hot coffee from there? That's all she asks.

Absolutely love Lola. The best coffee in PHX. Everyone that works at lola is so nice without being over the top. They always are friendly to greet. The drinks are always perfect--makes you feel totally ok spending 5 dollars on a coffee drink. Blueberry scones are spot on! My sister requests I bring these to CA every time I visit..they're that good. The coffee and espresso at Lola is just perfect and delicious. Keep coming back :)

Lola, on Roosevelt, is my favorite coffee shop in the Valley. They roast their beans on location and the quality of the coffee is superb. Jency and Lisa are the best baristas; always friendly, even if the last patron is the largest bitch or Richard. The tables and chairs are solid and comfortable; totally put Lux's lawn chairs to shame. And, lastly, if you are craving a treat with your beverage, they have the best baked goods. Overall, I don't any other place for coffee where they know your name, your drink and how to make your day.

Great coffee. Even more amazing soy chai.

The back patio is a great place to read for a little while in a sunny afternoon.

Also directly connected to Pita Jungle, so...win win. :D

In the midst of the great emptiness that is the depraved Phoenix aesthetic, Lola gives me hope that--someday--the people of this valley will awake from their masochistic delirium and create spaces consonant with our humanity. Until then, I'll be holed up at Lola.

I like Lolas coffee it tastes good and it's hot. And their food is tasty. And Jensey is a really friendly gal who works there. I wish all places that I go to have friendly people like her. 
I wish Lola's had more comfortable chairs there to sit on. I love the fact that they have an antique looking record player that plays a fun selection of eclectic music. And it's not blaring to the point that you can't hear yourself think. I have been to other coffee places in town and I can't even hear myself think at all. I mean really. Other than that I enjoy going there for coffee, food and friendly staff.

This is a great place to chill and have a great cup of coffee. The great pastries are freshly baked and the coffee beans are roasted every morning. The staff is friendly and make a real effort to remember your name. The decor is cool and they feature artwork by local artists.
I took one star away because they close at 7 during the week and at 2 on Sundays. Other than that, it's a great coffee shop.

Urgh...I keep trying this place but it's seemingly impossible (like at Lux on Central) to have a quiet coffee time. Music is, in my view (maybe I'm getting too old) always louder than necessary. To add to the cacophony today the staff were playing around w/ each other for some reason and all sorts of squealing that made it pretty much impossible to relax. Tea is good and scone was delicious but the atmosphere could be WAY more relaxing.

Lola's is my favorite spot for coffee, breakfast and just hanging out.  Very comfortable interior and seating on the front sidewalk and rear patio when the weather is good (which is most of the year).  My favorite things to order are the iced latte, brownie and the chocolate cake - okay those last two I order infrequently and only as a special treat.  For breakfast, their pastries and quiche really can't be beat.  We just recently relocated to the Roosevelt neighborhood and having Lola's in close proximity was a major draw because I always have a great place to meet up with people or visit with friends.
Great coffee, fantastic pastries. Love the omellette bar.

Been on my quest for looking for a new spot to study; wow that sounded NERDY! Please don't judge, eh to late. Despite reading all the reviews and getting lost trying to find this place, embarrassing I know. As mentioned by various Yelper's their Matador beverage was EPIC. I went there around 1ish even on Spring Break this place was busy. The atmosphere to subtle, their music wasn't overly loud, good tunes. Overall I recommend this place.
Cute and cozy! My breakfast was better than anticipated! The coffee was not your ordinary coffee, lots of flavor and richness!

Try the cafe blanco! It's divine. This place is a gem, highly recommend you visit. Pastry selection is yummy, and includes vegan items.  The space is comfortable and creative, perfect for studying or working.
Good coffee and very consistant quality. The staff is friendly and always fun to chat with. The only negative is that it isn't within walking distance from my office! Oh well, still worth the drive.

An awesome hang out for a nice latte and delicious pastries. Listen to some samba music and lay back. They have a nice outdoor seating also. If you are looking for a place to chill in the downtown area, this cafe is probably one of the nicest in the downtown area.
Been coming here for past 6 months.  And I have not looked for any other coffee joints.  Coffee is superb!  I love it here, the owner definitely has passion and great taste.

Good Coffee, Friendly service for the most part
Haven;t tried their food yet, but the baked goods are BOMB. 

Check it out if you are on the west side of downtown. 


weird hours
don't open until seven.

Lola has the best vanilla iced coffee in Phoenix, hands down! Whenever I am downtown I make it a point to stop by. The taste of their coffee is consistent. The outside patio is beautiful. I definitely recommended stopping by!

Worst watered down espresso I have ever had. And that was $3.50 .
Checked Yelp later, it was supposed to be closed at 7, I was there at 7:10. Would have been ok if they said they were closed and saved me some $$.

I used to live a stone's throw from this place, and I miss my early morning walks here for the perfect Americano. 

It's small, kind of cutely cluttered, and the perfect place to get some work done in the afternoon when it quiets down a bit. 

Get an Americano, or an Arnold Palmer with green tea and their house-made lemonade. You will not regret it.

Was there for breakfast during which was a big line so when I was ordering the cashier pushed through to get everybody. I wasn't finished and she took my payment, one of the things I wanted to ask was the cost for bottled spring water but instead got shocked with $18.00 for cup of black coffee, breakfast sandwich and the bottled spring water. Did not get a receipt or offered, had to go back in line to ask for it and not itemized. The coffee tasted very very good so after finishing I went to get refill (which by the way the cup here are small and cute and cost $2.50 for it!!!) Told the girl to leave room for cream and sugar completley disregarded me filling it to the top and than telling me $.50 for refill!!! I was appalled! I do NOT recommend this place, terrible prices, cattle service.
Coffee was good and Raspberry muffin was great. Back patio area was a great spot to enjoy.

I am writing this review for a missed jewel in the Lola family which is LOLA tapas.  I have seen so many reviews on yelp where people will throw 5 stars at anything.  Lola tapas is one restaurant that is worthy of a 5 star rating.  Too bad it closed.  Please consider reopening lola tapas and you honestly had the best food in town!

Lola's lattes taste like espresso, not the overly milky imitations that so many places serve. They're quick and friendly, too! Lola also features the best chocolate chip cookies I've ever tasted. My only complaint is the bathroom - unisex and in need of more regular sprucing. Everything else about the place is welcoming and charming. There's often someone with a cute dog on the patio, and the indoor patrons are all very civilized about sharing the limited space. This is definitely a place worthy of your money.

Lola is my husband and I's Saturday morning routine. It is also the place we went on a date on 8 years ago and I realized he was "the one," so it's a pretty special place for us. We love their coffee -- their cold brew is strong, but smooth.  My husband usually gets a latte, creamy and delicious. I get the most well done almond milk lattes every time. The milk is always the right consistency, people tend to over steam almond milk, but not here. 

I also enjoy the flavors in the matador when I want to branch away from my usual. Can't go wrong here. 

Another high point is their pastry case! The croissants are always so deliciously flakey and buttery (but without being greasy), chocolate chip cookies are delightful. Muffins are always so flavorful and moist.The tortilla espa√±ola is one of my favorite breakfast things, and I do have cravings for it every now and then. 

The baristas are always so friendly and helpful! 

Love this place and so happy Phoenix has it.

Great coffee, great atmosphere!!!!
I can concentrate on my PC work and sketch there!
Very good quality coffee, also great customer service.
I love the interior of the space, too. Very warmth wooden style, big window, and great furniture.

This is the place I go when I am in Phoenix!!!

This a quaint little place and I really liked their coffee and food! I had a caramel latte and breakfast burrito. Love the atmosphere here, however, it can get pretty busy since it is fairly tiny! Overall, it was a great little place!
A pretty basic coffee shop. But I do appreciate all the seating! It was a great set up for me and my website designer to meet up.
What a refreshing coffee shop. Quality drinks, friendly service, and a great environment. The Borgia over ice is delectable. Definitely a great find! Enjoy.

LOVE the tart!!!!!! I stopped by after studying in the library. I ordered the blackberry strawberry tart  I also got the matador coffee, not usually a big fan of cinnamon but the amount they put is perfect. It was not overwhelming. Next time I might consider studying here instead.
Beautiful place with beautiful people on a wonderful side of town.

Had the best latte I've had in a very long time here. Late night (6ish), woman barista with darker hair, this last sunday; she made it. Give that woman a raise!! She was extremely nice and is very talented at what she does. Also, the orange and chocolate biscotti was to die for. Good job, Lola's. I'll be back!!!

I love both locations equally. Such a delicious cafe caramel. I also really love their tea selections. The baristas are always friendly, and there's always a place to sit. What more can you ask for? :)

The coffee is great. The baked goods are fantastic. However, if you are a decaf person - beware. The last two times I've ordered decaf, I got fully caffeinated coffee. The first time, I didn't notice until it was too late. I had the shakes and sweats for hours after drinking what I thought was decaf. I debated on whether or not to call them to let them know. I did, and they seemed confused as to what I wanted from them. The next trip, after ordering decaf, I asked again when the coffee was ready if the coffee they just handed me was decaf. The answer was, "Oh, that was supposed to be decaf?" If you are caffeine-sensitive and love Lola's coffee, just be sure to confirm what they are giving you is indeed what you ordered.

This is my review of the opening night:

I am a huge fan of the other Lola Coffee so when they said they were opening another location I knew I wanted to give it a try.  

I showed up pretty much right at 7pm on opening day Dec. 18 2009.  I went inside and asked if they were taking credit cards on opening night.  They said that they weren't charging on opening night which was very nice.  So I went and ordered my standard double-mocha.  While I was waiting I took in the visuals the new Lola has to offer.  This location seems to have a front of house that is smaller than the Central Ave. location however this is the opposite of a bad thing.  The slightly smaller size lends an intimacy to the place that is very inviting.  It has significantly higher ceilings and the hallway leading out the back door has two cozy and somewhat secluded tables (this would be great if you and your honey wanted to have some quality time together).  The decor is what I would classify as modern with some exposed structural elements in the front of the coffeehouse, a distressed table, and some nice metalwork.  You're also treated to the sight of a coffee bean roaster towards the back of the room.

I got my mocha and, since I was one of the first arrivals, had no problem finding a table (the distressed one).  As I sat sipping my drink and  perusing a book about the Great Barrier Reef I noticed that the place filled with people very quickly.  I ended up talking to an employee of Lola Coffee North (or LoNo as I call it now) for a while.  I then spoke to another woman associated with the business about some of Lola's green features.  It was then time for me to go so I retrieved my bicycle and headed to the nearby Central/Roosevelt light-rail station.

PS: the coffee was very good.
Lola is OUTSTANDING! By far the best coffee, the best baristas, and best atmosphere on the planet.

Lola is still my very favorite local coffee stop. We moved a little further away but that hasn't stopped me from making special trips for my favorite favorite iced coffee (it's perfect!). Parking is tricky depending on the time of day, but honestly no matter where I live in the Valley I will always come to Lola for my World's Greatest Iced Coffee.

I can't review their coffee because the rude salesgirl wouldn't let us buy any. We came here around 7pm on a Friday. The door says they are open until 10. The yelp profile says the same. She was on the phone with a friend gossiping when we came in. We stand there for at least 5mins before she noticed and said "oh yeah, we're closed." wtf?
Make sure you have a half hour before ordering here! Wow. In an airport and only four in line.

On recommendation from a friend, I recently tried Lolas. He told me to go to the central location, but I was in the area, so I stopped into this one. 

Upon entering, I ordered two drip coffees for my boyfriend and I. The response I got was, "I'm not brewing anymore drip today." Apparently, they close at 7 and 6:15 is too late for coffee in a coffee shop. I then suggested she could make us Cafe Americano's instead. I asked for skim milk in one of them, and in response, a gallon of skim milk was slammed down in front of me. 

As I sat drinking my watered down cafe americano, the barista began sweeping around us. The dirt was flying everywhere. At that moment, I decided we needed to leave. The only thing keeping me from taking a steaming shit on the floor was the 3 cops sitting in the corner of the shop. 

I'd rather get coffee at a shell station. I suggest you do the same.

My coffee was delicious and the ambience of the cafe is nice. They have lots of ports for charging and comfy chairs for naps. The big problem here is customer service. They take way to long to do anything. They also talk to other employees from the airport about things they shouldn't while dropping the f bomb to complain about who I would guess is a manager of some sort. Maybe they forgot that my daughter and I was in the cafe...management needs to step up.

New to the downtown Phoenix area from out of state. I come to Lola Coffee on N. 3rd out of convenience as it's the closest to my apartment in the Roosevelt neighborhood.
People seem to either LOVE this place or HATE it.....I wouldn't say I hate it, but it's not my favorite place either. While the coffee and food selections are quite good, that alone is NOT enough to guarantee a continual loyal customer base.
The customer service here is atrocious-if not non-existent.....getting you through the line as quickly as possible with the least amount of warmth or interest seems to be the goal. On more than 1 occasion I have gotten the wrong quiche order, whipped creme on a drink I specifically said "no whip", or wrong size drink I specified.
Would these things have been corrected had I brought the mistake to the attention of the staff? Probably, but it should have been right the first time.....the fact that it has happened more than once says something about their process or my ability to speak clearly.
This location seems more concerned with being edgy and non conformist than providing a stellar customer service experience. I do not feel the staff works cohesively as a group. They each seem DEEPLY focused on what their tasks are, thus resulting in  minimal/no interaction with customers...I say THANK YOU for everything and rarely get a response or acknowledgement here.....it's a busy place for sure, but hopefully not too busy for common courtesy...
Like I said earlier, I come here out of convenance, but a competing coffee giant is opening a few blocks down in a few weeks. I will be going there because the are more organized, have a strict customer service policy and policies in place that ensure a consistent customer experience every visit.
Friendly staff, easy enough to find, and very good coffee. Definitely gonna be one of my new haunts.

Delicious/world class coffee.  The baked goods are SUPERB.  

This cafe reminds me of a place in either Spain or the south of France.  Relaxed and attentive yet very casual, with a strict control of food quality.  Highly recommend. 

If you're new to Phoenix this is a MUST.

I've had a lot of coffee, in a lot of places, and Lola is my all-time favorite.  I love their iced coffee, which is reasonably priced and has a single shot of espresso in it (cheaters).  Also their omelette bar is worth a shot on the weekends for a healthy brunch.  

They usually rotate their art out once a month, supporting the local art scene, and keep lots of local event info around.  Background music is pretty good and non-intrusive, and there are always a few interesting folks around.  

Usually stop by for an iced coffee on the weekend, then buy a bag of locally roasted beans to take home for work-day mornings.  Can't go wrong with the location, or their coffee.

I live between Los Angeles and Phoenix and Lola is by far my favorite coffee shop.  The coffee quality is excellent (I personally love their iced coffees because they add a shot of espresso to them for a full strength and rich flavor), the service is the most efficient and consistent I have ever experienced, the pastry and breakfast items are always fresh and delicious, the prices are reasonable, they sell their brand of coffee and will even grind it for you if you desire, their Arnold Palmers are made from fresh squeezed lemons and the best I've ever had, and I love the feel of the space. I am still searching in LA for my coffee counterpart. I hope Lola decides to open a shop there and make my wildest dreams come true! Thank you, Lola, for being awesome.

I always go here to get some grading done. Their americanos are delicious and the staff is always very friendly! It's a smaller coffee shop with some seating inside and more tables outside in the back; since the weather is beautiful now I like to sit outside and have my coffee. I'm not one who usually buys pastries or sweets at coffee shops, but I have had one of their cookies before and I really enjoyed it.

Delicious coffee - not too strong. Flavoring is to die for - no slacking on high quality flavoring for that caramel macchiato nor iced mocha or vanilla coffees. Here at Lola's, they aim to please. Fresh muffins and pastries that are quite good that they handmade on site.  Staff is always friendly despite how busy they are. Atmosphere is great for hanging out, I only wish it were not so loud. Some seating out back rocks if you're lucky enough to score a spot. Parking is a pain in the ass. Still, I would recommend this place in a heartbeat and I continue to return again and again.  Don't pass this place up if you have a chance to try it out, folks!

Lola embodies what supporting local companies is about! They've assembled a first rate company that consistently serves EXCELLENT java and offers a wonderful assortment of pastries. The setting is amazing with big windows facing the road that let in lots of sunshine. Wonderful melodies are constantly playing and I especially like the retro stereo. I pop in only before work so I 've yet to spend time and soak up the atmosphere, but this is a local company that Phoenix can take pride in.

My first visit to Lola, and I have to say I was quite impressed.  Above all the service and product were perfect. But it's also looks like it would be a great place to meet friends or sit and get some business accomplished. My wife is a barista.  Both of my daughters are baristas.  I have a bit of an idea how this works, and they do it well at Lola. One of my family's pet peeves is arriving at the counter at our local coffee shop to find our "regular drink" ready without even having to ask.  It bothers my wife and daughters that their coworkers will do this for regular customers. Heaven forbid they should choose to try something new one day.  I don't know the barista's name at Lola this morning, but I heard her ask several regular customers if they would be having their regular drink before she made it.  Icing on the cake for me.

As I sit writing this review, swilling my mocha and nibbling a scone I'm already planning when I can come back....

I'd always seen this place when I drive by on my way to Bliss/reBar, and my coworker lives behind them and had nothing but good things to say about this place.

I must say, the coffee is delicious. I stopped by to have breakfast and caffeinate up before the Phoenix Comicon, and got the iced mocha. On a whim I decided to splurge on the whipped cream calories. 

O.M.G. That whipped cream had coffee in it. It was DELICIOUS. My boyfriend got his cafe caramel hot, and it came with latte art on it! (Silly, I know, but I've yet to experience latte art first hand). He loved the coffee. He described it as having notes of... peanut and chocolate? Or maybe it was another place's. Regardless, he's picky about his coffee and he loved it. 

We also got omelettes off the omelette bar. It's really quite simple, but they did it very well. I got mine with mushrooms and caramelized onions, and they went heavy on the fresh cracked pepper, which I love.

The decor in this place is pretty awesome. It's got raw exposed brick, concerete floors, an industrial vibe going on. I loved the reclaimed wood tables, and it's fun to see where they roast the beans, and to know that they roast their own. 

I don't live and work near this place, which I am somewhat grateful for. Otherwise, I'd be getting fat off of iced mochas with coffee whipped cream. That's not fun.
Great coffee! The staff isn't always the friendliest but the coffee is always good. Their chocolate croissants are the best!

I've never been disappointed by this place! It's worth driving in PHX traffic for, seriously. I get the iced caramel Latte, so amazing! Their dessert choices always look so tempting & the whipped cream that they make is heavenly!!

(The coffee = good Tea = good.  Not the best)  The location = great.  Perfect setting for a neighborhood coffee shop.  The inside = great.  Communal seatting, cozy, not to busy; very entreating.  Menu = so-so.  Not much going on in this department and what is darn expensive for cookies and cakes by any one's standards.

Wonderful coffee shop. It's hard to find coffee shops in downtown Phoenix where you won't feel judged by the slew of hipsters that populate it. I felt very comfortable here, and came on a rainy day so the shop was still pretty full but not too point where I couldn't navigate through the tables.

I ordered a cafe caramel and got the tortilla espanola which was NO JOKE by the way. It was so good. The cafe caramel had a hint of caramel and their roast (didn't ask what they use) was strong and beautiful and everything that is right with the world when you get that jolt of caffeine in the morning.

TIP- Park at the gold parking lot right behind the coffee shop!

There was dirt in their ice.

I ordered a bottle of sparkiing water and an iced green tea.

Decent WIFI, but I won't go back, because there was dirt in their ice.

Lola is in a great location on Roosevelt near Central, next to Pita Jungle. It's spacious inside with high ceilings and full of couches, tables and bars. They have a kitchen too and a decent mix off snacks on the menu. The coffee is strong and flavorful and they have all the standard espresso drinks too.

This coffee shop is confortable, tastefully decorated and well located. Staff is friendly and the coffee is great. But the music is so loud, this place is noisier than some bars. The baristas have to yell their orders through the din. Do the owners really understand coffee culture? I now go to Songbrid instead. It is a pity, because some classic jazz in the background would make this an unbeatable place.

I would probably go here daily if I lived nearby. Lola is a great spot to relax and get some work done. I stopped by this morning while waiting for my dry cleaning next door and was impressed by the prompt service, even on a busy morning. I hate to admit it, but the Starbucks drive-thru is usually my go to morning coffee stop, but this morning's trip to Lola proved to me that it's worth taking a little more time for a better product. My caramel latte, blueberry scone, and bell pepper quiche were all magnificent, and the kicker was it took far less time than the "convenient" Starbucks drive-thru! 

I'd also recommend stopping by when you have no time constraints. Lola's cappuccinos are quite lovely.

I refer to Lola's and the "Hipster" coffee shop and more. Why? Because everyone dresses hip and they all seems so laid back and chill in this little gem. The customer service is second to none, the place is very clean and the coffee is superb. 

They make in addition to great coffee, bomb omelettes, quiches, and other bakery goods.
Coffee is strong but good. Not a lot of food options, but the pastries looked amazing.
Best coffee I've had in a long time.  The Caramel Latte is to die for.  The owner is super nice and wrote me immediately after I had inquired about what type of Caramel they used.  A+++
The food here comes much faster than most coffee shops. Customizable breakfast sandwiches are fantastic and very well sized for the price.
Coffee was average.  Friendly people and nice outdoor seating.  No water misters outside so it's warm.

Updated review 3-2-2018

I live steps away from Lola and usually like coming here. I come here often to get a coffee with neighbors/friends or simply to read a book. I agree with reviewers that sometimes the service can be lackluster but usually the baristas are great. However today I was extremely disappointed by Eric's service, the guy was manning the cash counter. He simply did not understand my order, I must have repeated it like 5 times. Initially I thought he was being goofy, and by the fifth time (no effort made to clarify my request),he was sort of mocking me. No other way to interpret it. The guy was unapologetic and made no effort to get my business when I walked off. Pathetic customer service. Lola owners: please get your act together, train employees like Eric to be courteous and sincere, and have them represent you well. I will gladly take my $$ to other cafes that are popping up all over Roosevelt and downtown if incidents like these reoccur.

My home away from home. 

I write some keyword blogs for a living so I need someplace to work. I go here and try to look like I am working on a script instead because the hipster girls like that.

The baristas are all lovely ladies (Except Joreal [sp?] but he is cool as shit so I let it slide).

The coffee is divine. The place is hip and you will run in to myself and/or Wayne almost daily and that's cool right?

I ordered the italian flat bread. It was super moist. (when it comes to flat bread, "moist" is an automatic fail of course).

I also had a latte with almond syrope. Before this I don't remember the last time I had to throw a coffee away. Yes, it was that bad.

I can't get enough of their chocolate croissants!! Super delicious and recommend that you get it warmed up so that the chocolate is soft and gooey. I usually get the lattes with whip cream and the baristas never disappoint!  The feel of the coffee shop is great with super cute decor and plenty of space to sit. They have a small patio in the back, so I'll bring my pup and just relax with my latte. Customer service is always great too! Definitely recommend this cute coffee shop!

I can walk there!!!

 Not, like, a real city person walk. I mean a "Phoenix, Arizona, this is totally walking distance from my office" kind of situation. So, I am in heaven. 

That being said, I'm not sure I can see myself hanging out at Lola. It was sort of chilly inside (both temperature wise and general tone). But, I have been enjoying the coffee. 

The first time I went to Lola, I got their version of a white mocha - very very good.

Today I picked their drip coffee and asked for hazelnut flavoring to be added. I was pleasantly surprised that I was not charged extra for the hazelnut, that I ALMOST tipped the girl ... if only she would have smiled ... or made me feel remotely welcome. 

So, Lola could use some customer service spiffying up (based on other reviews I read as well), but it's not going to stop me from going there. 

Did I mention I can walk there? 

Oh, and the coffee today was really quite good.

4 Stars but this little spot has great potential to be a regular stop for me and will likely rate a 5th. Rode my motorcycle downtown to try Lola Coffee and I was not disappointed. The Cafe Mocha with some whipped cream was just perfect. I also tried the quiche, warmed up, which was also tasty. I sat outside in the little patio area. A little warm this time of year, even this early in the summer but it IS shaded and really pretty relaxing. It's just off the street (Roosevelt) but you still get the feeling of separation and intimacy in the spot. I can see this being perfect during cooler weather. I'll be going back to try their other offerings, but first impression: I would highly recommend Lola Coffee.

Second visit to Lola and it didn't disappoint. It was very crowded on this particular day so seating was limited. It was almost impossible to walk through with a small stroller. So if you bring your kids in one, be careful not to hit the other patrons while moving through the shop. Altogether a very cool, hip spot with good drinks.

I got their caramel latte with their house whipped cream as  recommended. The caramel latte was good but the star was definitely the whipped cream. It was so good!! You have to get it on any drink if you come here!

My latte was great.  The blackberry turnover was so good I had to fight with myself to not go back and buy another.  But the frittata was really terrible.  It was about 4 inches tall and a weird pale grey/brown color with an spongy texture.  That is not what a frittata is supposed to look like or taste like.  I ate 2-3 bites and then had to toss it.  Don't waste you money on it.  Buy 2 pastries instead.
Good food,happy people...It's a nice little place to enjoy the beautiful mornings in Arizona!

I give this place a five star for a few reasons...

1- I really dig the Roosevelt area. Wasn't crowded at all on a Sunday afternoon and the surrounding buildings and palm trees make for a great leisurely walk with your coffee.
2- The service was great. The barista working was enjoying  a slower moment out on a bench with friends in front of the shop and as we arrived she got up immediately, greeted us kindly and told us she was going to go wash her hands before helping us and making our drinks. Having worked at a coffee joint myself once, I understand the slow times and the perks of helping a shift go by much easier when friends stop by and I'm glad she gets to hang out while understanding the importance of customer service. Go you barista lady!
3- The drinks were great! What more can you really ask for when you are purchasing a coffee. I got a large iced mocha with two shots instead of four (four would kill me) and my boyfriend got a medium iced latte. We are kind of coffee snobs and the drinks were wonderful. I normally order an iced toddy or an iced americano but was feeling rather indulgent that day.
4- The atmosphere was my style. Big open room, great tunes!, lots of places to sit to use your laptop, seating outside in front of the shop as well as great seating outdoors behind the shop and here's the kicker.. the bathrooms were clean and I didn't cringe or hold my breath while using it.
5- They are local and they hang local art. Anything local in my book, is a win.

This place is great. On my days off it will be a great place to sit and escape with my laptop or my current read.

I have passed this place so many times and I always say I am going to stop and try it!  I finally did and I am so glad I did.  I love chai lattes so of course I had to try theirs.  It was awesome!  It was the perfect amount of sweetness and spice.  The atmosphere is open and it looks like a great place to come with some friends or to just come by yourself with your laptop and do what you need to do.  The girl was by herself behind the counter so she was a little overwhelmed but its ok because my drink was great!  Thank you!

The coffee is good here. What I'm really giving 5 stars for, however, is the ambiance and vibe. If only I lived closer, I'd hang out here more often, though perhaps living further away makes it a more special trip when I do get to come here. Big windows allowing lots of natural light, open floor plan, a mix of people both in age and demographic, and again, just a very pleasant atmosphere to catch up with a friend or read a book solo.
Too pricy on the food i ordered a breakfast burrito with a small iced coffee and paid $19 and it was not good!
I love Lola... the matador is simply craveable!

I love this coffee shop..the area is perfect
And the inside is spacious enough. 

They also offer breakfast pastries and now burritos. I have yet to try the burritos but the pastries are on point. 

I usually get an iced chai latte and it's made perfectly. I usually add extra cinnamon which is on the side bar. They have a lot of extras you can add too!

Cool scene - indoors and outdoors - with the hipsters and gays of Phoenix. Great coffee and pastries.

Air conditioning could have been stronger and acoustics made conversation challenging.

Something I enjoy about Lola's (as opposed to some of my other CenPho coffee favorites) is that it is CONSISTENT!  I do not have to worry about which barista is working or what drink I order - it is always good. 

-The staff is always friendly and takes time to get to know their regulars.
-They always have great music playing.  
-Aside from their pastry case, they usually have some hot food you can order. 
-They have the best whip cream around - seriously.  I never order whip cream at any other coffee shop, but I really don't mind those extra calories here.  

My least favorite things about this place: their seating.  Yes, those old metal school chairs look fabulous - but they are cold and uncomfortable!  If I'm going to hang out there for a few hours, I don't want my butt to go numb from uncomfortable seating.
Coffee is delicious, such flavor and depth. Food is savory, sweet and creative. Lovely hangout spot, as well.

I have become a regular here when I decided to switch my business to local AZ, and have never looked back. Lola's on Roosevelt is by far my favorite cup of coffee in town. I am still exploring local coffee spots but Lola's is the best, always a quality drink and pastry! The coffee is strong and the flavor full. All of the baristas are great and just spending time in the atmosphere is great with something to work on, or a friend.

My husband and I buy their beans every two weeks and brew at home! We love the quality and the price that Lola sells! They did recently go up $3 of their beans but for us it's still worth it still beats lux and other coffee shops price per oz!

Great food but the process is a little broken to get your food.  You build your meal to order instead of a menu which can be nice but also very time consuming.  You have to wait for your order in a crowded area since it won't be delivered.  The food was very good but outside the flies were horrible to the point we didn't want to stay long.
One of my new favorite coffee shops.  Really, really good espresso and friendly staff.  The atmosphere is very relaxed and inviting.  Recommend to anyone who loves good coffee and espresso.

Oh Lola, you are soo freaken adorable!!! :)
I am in L-O-V-E with this coffee shop, so laid back and hip!! I love its comfy feeling and sudden relaxing effect it has over you as soon as you step in, it's clean, modern and beautifully decorated all over!!!  
Oh and yeah my Chai was oh so yummy along with a cherry scone! 
The girl that helped us was super nice and knowledgeable of the drinks and baked goodies this coffee shop offers. I would gladly want to own a coffee shop similar to this one someday!!! :)

Quaint atmosphere; the tortilla Enspanola and the veggie quiche was great. Variety of seating spaces; good for an early morning breakfast or a good read. Fresh OJ was delicious; the pulp and seeds were at the bottom of the cup.

So I went to Lola a few days ago thinking the local coffee shop would be great considering all the people in there. BOOOOY was I wrong. All those "people" in the shop were just pretentious little hipster kids and the staff (one confused looking girl) didn't know ANYTHING about coffee. She was stuck up, non interested and just plain rude. I ordered a large vanilla late and received a medium regular late, no vanilla. It wasn't a friendly place, I felt unwelcome there and I'll NEVER go back or recommend that place. If your looking for a good coffee shop downtown hit up JOBOT, the people are friendly and the drinks are a million times better.

Great atmosphere. My friend loved the coffee he ordered. I'm always disappointed, though, when I go to a cool local coffee shop, order a chai latte, and see them grab a box of Tazo mix. I wish they would show as much care in the choice of chai as they do in coffee. That's not enough of an annoyance to stop my coming back, though.

Mmmm surprised I haven't reviewed this yet but they've got pretty amazing pastries. It must have been over a year ago when I came in with my friend Roxy and enjoyed a strawberry crumble. 

Just last Friday I returned to meet my friend Cole and his mom. They were sharing a mocha, espresso, and almond milk so I followed their lead and couldn't have been happier. This was real strong and I'm definitely happy I got a small especially since it costs almost five dollars!!! 

They've got a back door area as well and good ambiance too but as per the usual downtown, parking is quite the hassle.

Fantastic coffee & espresso: I'm not on the apparently growing super-high-acidity bandwagon, so I enjoy what I'd describe as the strong, but balanced roast Lola produces -- perhaps more importantly, the staff is incredibly friendly and skilled in their craft. I go here several times a week and have never had an unpleasant interaction or a poorly made drink, from when I started coming almost a year ago till now. Prices are very reasonable and, key for me, pre-include tax & are all round to the quarter, so paying with cash is a breeze. 

The interior aesthetic has a rustic-urban feel which for a Nor-easterner like me feels like a very comforting blend of "old" and true-to-the-region. Fresh flowers and other greenery are always kept on the tables, which really warms the place up, and work from local artists rotates regularly, so there's always something new and interesting to look at on the walls. 

There are lots of options when it comes to how quiet, lively, or distraction-free you're looking for: between outdoor seating both street-side and in a quiet, shady courtyard out back, tables in the lively main room and some in the more secluded back hallway. (& bike racks both in front and in back!) Most of the chairs are vintage(esque) ergonomic, backed metal. I've read some other reviews on here that really knock the chairs, but I've got a bad lower back, and I have to say, the short-list of chairs I can sit in for more than a couple hours without the onset of pain includes Herman Miller Aerons and these chairs at Lola (there are a few wooden-backed, velvet upholstered ones which aren't nearly as comfortable, as well as some old draft-table and short metal stools which are no problem comfort-wise). 

All in all great place. My favorite of all the coffee joints in Phoenix, I'd say.

Great coffee and friendly people! They do a darker roast than what I consider my personal, perfect espresso.... but for a darker roast, it's perfect! Very minimal bitters, and clove influenced cocoa is what comes to mind while enjoying my morning shots :)

Great place. Super tasty stuff. However, don't let "The Predator" make your order. You'll know her when you see her. Big, mean dreaded lady. She's the least consistent out of all the employees and she's mean!!! Other than that, this place is pretty great.

Lola is a great coffee shop in downtown Phoenix. Whether you are from the area or looking for a new spot, it's a great place.  For starters they have a great Blanco and Mocha coffee, with the best whip cream I've had (they flavor it with espresso). The vibe is hip and they feature rotating local art. 

The drawbacks for Lola are poorly designed seating and their breakfast menu. The room fills up artificially quick because most of the seating is occupied by one person while being designed for 2 or 4 people. Coming to Lola with another person or *gasp* more can be a problem if you want to sit together! Also, they have one of the worst omelets ever. Seriously. Denny's is better. They are not a restaurant, they are a coffee shop trying to expand their offerings- sadly it was done poorly. If you want a bite here, get a baked good- they won't blow you away but they won't remind you of the LOST finale (that's the omelet!). 

On a side note, the last time I went to Lola (about 2 months ago) I had the worst customer service experience of my life. It's not worth going into, and it certainly does not represent the otherwise great people, but without that trip I would have been hard pressed to give Lola at least 4 stars.

Stopped in after having lunch at Pita Jungle next door. First time here and seemed like a typical coffee shop but that is what it is. The first thing I noticed was the smell, it smelled great! Fresh roasted coffee hit my nose as soon as I walked in, I knew it was going to be good. 
I ordered a mocha and when she told me the price it was the price on the menu. Tax must be built in but I think that is the way it SHOULD be. My coffee had a little leaf design and tasted and smelled as good as it looked. 

Definitely will stop by again when in the area.  Plenty of seating, good atmosphere and a lot of open laptops. A nice place to hang out and smell the coffee!

Ordered my go to iced coffee with almond milk. Came to $3.25 which in my opinion, is quite reasonable. The barista even put in a shot of espresso on the house. I try to visit a new coffee spot every Saturday morning, this has been my favorite so far. Definitely tripped on the way in the door.

Super cute coffee shop! Park in the " gold" parking structure located directly behind the building-it's free and easier then searching for street spots! I ordered the skinny iced vanilla latte-$4.50 for a large! Drink was tasty and a  perfect blend to me of the sweetness not overly sweet but not a strong coffee taste.  The inside is on the smaller size and did fill quick but they do have seating outside as well! Lots of pastries to choose from even at 1130am! Studied inside and didn't find the noise to loud.

I've only ever had a latte and a slice of the tortilla espanola. Both were pretty good. I'd give this place another chance. The service was okay. Not too friendly or vocal (we didn't know our order was ready because no one at the counter said a word beyond the first coffee prepared. They let us stand there while our food got cold until we figured the to go order was  ours). I'm hoping this was a one time issue.
I'm biased as I live across the street, but...  It remains my go-to place for cafe.  And, if I'm not careful, Lola will be the reason why I blow up to 300 lbs.  (The baked goods are awesome.)

I just moved in across the street. So I have been walking here and grabbing a pastry and or a mocha. 

This place has two entrances, one in the rear, or the main door located right off of roosevelt. 

The staff are very very friendly, even the people whom frequent this spot are very pleasant, I struck up a conversation with a man while I was waiting for my mocha just the other day. 

I stopped at the fair trade cafe just up the street and that place is rated very highly but I had a horrible experience there so I recommend this place much more over the latter.

Excellent coffee, cozy space, and well-shaded patio. Better for socializing than working on your laptop. Outlets are limited. Also, because the space is tight (which I do like in a coffee shop), people can see everything on your computer, everything you're working on etc. I don't do anything that would raise eyebrows, of course, but I just feel a bit too exposed when I work here. That being said, Lola is a fabulous coffee shop for hanging out with 2 or 3 friends or just stopping by for a joe fix.

I've been here 3 times!! 1 time on the weekend for morning coffee, 1 time in the morning before work and once during lunch hours. Everytime it has been a pleasant experience.
Quick service, strong coffee, relaxed setting & inside/outside seating. Def. recommend!! Too bad we didn't have more shop's like this on the west side.
One of the best chai hot teas I have had as well as there NY style cheescake. All there baked goods are made daily from scratch

I can't give a thorough review of this place, since I only got myself an iced mocha, and it's damn hard to make a bad iced mocha. But! I liked the interior and the pastries looked incredible. On the downside, as another reviewer mentioned, it is LOUD inside. Loud and busy.

What's most important about this second outpost of Lola Coffee is that it doesn't stray from its original formula and doesn't neglect the history of the Gold Spot building. High ceilings, lots of natural light, old-time fixtures and concrete floors -- I imagine this is what the old grocery looked like some 80 years ago in this very spot. Nicely done!

What really makes this spot better than the original location is the full roastery room and kitchen. So, while you're enjoying your cup of coffee, you can smell the sweet, smokey goodness of Lola Espresso Roast wafting up the rafters, as well as the heavenly perfection of Sweet Pea baked goods. You can't beat that.

This was one of the real highlights of my trip into Phoenix/Tempe.  I was dead set on having a chocolate croissant and iced mocha for breakfast.  I searched through yelp result after yelp result and always the reviews were the same, well rated by most, but those who didn't rate places well said the service stank or the places too closely followed Starbucks and way over-roasted their coffee.  Lola's was the one that stood out as having no real negatives.  I can see why.

My chocolate croissant was excellent.  Flaky, buttery, and not shy with the chocolate. It was a bit weird to get it with a knife and fork.

My iced mocha was excellent, chocolaty, but not so much so or so sugary that I couldn't taste the coffee.  Admittedly it was a touch more bitter than I generally prefer but not so much that it detracted from my enjoyment of the drink.

The staff, although a bit rushed the whole time, was friendly and helpful.  The vibe was industrial hipster, but for all that I blatantly stood out there (in Umbrella Co tac gear) I didn't really feel out of place or too bombarded by the trendy vibe (which sadly has done a lot to ruin what was my favourite coffee place in Vegas).  There was plenty of seating, and the chair I claimed was very comfortable. There is plenty of parking, which surprised me, and their outdoor patio was very nice.

I will miss Lola's.

Lola coffee is a great coffee shop. Many people tend to rave about it and I know quite a few people who say it is delicious. I can attest to them having a great mocha and dirty chia. It can get quite cramped inside when busy, but there's always outside to chill when it's not too hot.

I LOVE this spot!!

As others have mentioned, when I made my first trip to Lola, I didn't know if it was a hipster reunion or a coffee shop. The staff were in a conversation and took a while to acknowledge me. 

I gave it another chance and am so glad that I did. I have come to love the place. The coffee is SO tasty, I no longer need ten pumps of flavored sugar to drink it. 

The staff are super friendly and warm to the point that you might think they are religious missionaries. I think it is sad and unfortunate that some reviewers are judging the staff based on body art or clothing. Really? It's 2010, chances are good your accountant AND physician have tatts or piercings. 

Tonight I took my sister to Lola for dessert and we had a great time. The staff are friendly and warm, and made great suggestions. The barrista even gave us a hot tip on a local concert. 

I live in the area and there is no finer spot for coffee. Fair Trade is musty and s-l-o-w. Check out Lola, it's a winner. 

Oh yah, they also have great music- it's nice to sit with a great drink and relax.

Lola Coffee catered coffee for our wedding in downtown Phoenix. They were really nice to work with, went above and beyond our expectations, and everyone loved the coffee (parents and grandparents actually commented on how good it was).

I love the original location and I have given it much praise since I do love their coffee, especially the Matador. I was so excited to come here ever since I heard that they opened a location downtown but WHAT A disappointment it has been. I honestly just dont feel welcome like I do at the other location and just like PREVIOUS reviews have stated, the staff is rude, especially the guy that makes the coffee makes me feel like I am unwanted as a customer there and same goes for the cashier. The owner Daniel? is really cool and always greets people nicely but the staff at this location is just too good for the public or something, plus some of those chairs are extremely uncomfortable, so for now I will have to skip this location and go to the one that's farthest from me to get my delicious Matador.

The staff is always friendly and super quick. I know a lot of times people complain that non starbucks type places take too long but it certainly isn't the case here. The iced caramel is my go to and the matador is delicious but super rich and sweet.

They always pull the perfect shot of their full bodied Lola's espresso blend. Lola's is located in the historic Gold Spot Market, has a wonderful outdoor patio and the perfect vibe for grabbing your morning constitutional, hanging with friends or being productive.
Great place for a Chai and a relaxing clear your head moment. Love the ambiance and the music was top notch!

I had the Matador which was mocha with cinnamon. It was very good, the coffee here is better than Starbucks but not nearly as good as the coffee home roasted at Village Coffee Roastery in Scottsdale (get the dirty chai or cappuccino there, both are to die for) or Cabin Coffee Cafe in Glendale (the honey bear is incredible). Although this place was somewhat busy it was very quiet and the atmosphere was very relaxed. There is seating inside as well as outside. The style of this coffee house is very airy and open, I remember there was a lot of natural lighting coming in so it wasn't dark or relied on artificial lighting as much as other coffee houses. It almost felt as though I was in someone's kitchen, not a business, which may seem strange but it was actually comfortable. I hope to come back and try more caffeinated concoctions here.
Delicious! Delicious pastries & delicious coffee. Everyone is super sweet and gets my order right all the time. I definitely recommend this spot to others.

Nice location. The indoor seating is social.. It is a friendly community establishment. The staff is friendly and the service is good. You can sit outside if you wish, and the food is very good. I would recommend Lola Cafe!

I recommend Lola over any other coffee in Downtown Phoenix. 

They consistently do everything better, faster, and cheaper than the competition. The coffee is strong, reasonably priced, and there's a decent menu variety. I live nearby and have had to limit myself to 2 visits per week or my budget app starts chastising me with notifications reminding me how weak I am for a good latte and scone.

Treat yourself: Try the whipped cream at least once. It's incredible.

This small downtown cafe had delicious coffee, reasonable prices, and irresistible, homemade parfaits. I just wish their shop was a little bit bigger to cater for the amount of traffic they receive, so that they could put more seating in for customers. Great morning spot with a fun vibe though!

Our iced vanilla americano was good and not too sweet.  I was more impressed with the omelette!  It was moist (nothing worse than a dry omelette!!) and well seasoned, and the havarti was a nice addition.  I think 1$ per additional veggie is a bit of a rip off, but otherwise well priced.  The only strange thing is that the salsa comes with the food at the window, but the garlic aioli needs to come from the girls at the front?? Strange.  But still yummy.

Cute indoor and outdoor seating and we had no problem finding a parking spot within a block during the week around 9am.

My favorite cafe downtown, I've never ordered anything but the Americano because it's just right every time. I love it.  I did order a pecan pumpkin pie slice today which was very good, I liked how light the filing is.  It wasn't heavy or overbearing.  The pecan nuts were a great compliment to the south pumpkin filing and the crust was perfect, still in top of my list of favorite places to decompress and grab a snack. Kudos Lola

I frequent Lola Coffee on Central and Lux Coffee as well but I was very disappointed in this one. The location is quaint and the building eclectic; I do like the high ceilings but as far as comfort the coffee shops furniture are old school chairs, tables and vintage artist drafting chairs are beyond uncomfortable. Maybe they don't want people staying long but I wouldn't recommend this shop. The coffee is okay and the staff are wonderful unlike the staff at the Central location who barely say a word but I would have to say on a honest opinion, no thank you. I think there is always room for approval but they would need to makes some changes. They also close at 7pm which seems a little early for the city.

Nice coffee shop. Cool hipster spot with better than average coffee and espresso drinks. I had the Matador, which is what everyone recommends, it was alright but a little to nutmagy for me. My wife got a dirty Chai tea latte, which she said was pretty good. Plenty of seating, but a little noisy to try and work. They also have a variety of bakery products.

Cute place - great vibe, but the coffee and espresso lack flavor and depth. My daughter thoroughly enjoyed her dessert in a cup (iced vanilla mocha), but my Americano and my husband's coffee lacked flavor. Granted, were connoisseurs, so our expectation is greater than the average consumer, but it was disappointing nonetheless.
This is our favorite coffee shop in town. We bring visitors here specifically for the Matador if they are coffee drinkers. The omelets are worth it too. Enjoy!!
Great place to chill and just enjoy the atmosphere, great coffee and blueberry muffins that can't be beat. Recommended.
The coffee here was substandard. The blueberry muffin tasted packaged. (We hear their other baked goods were better.) The vibe is stuck somewhere between a college coffee shop and a strip mall.

I'm usually not this far out west in The Valley, but I happened to be in the area and was looking for a cafe to rest in for a while. 
The coffee has a very unique flavor, not necessarily my favorite but still great. It's my first time having coffee with such depth to its taste.  Usually I need sugar in my latte, but this was fine without it.
The ambience was nice, not too noisy or too hushed. The guys working there were all great. 
The best part of all- they do latte art. This is the first cafe in the valley where I've gotten it! I was so happy! 

It's a close walk to the Japanese Friendship Garden, so it could be a nice place to rest afterwards!
I wish the coffee wasn't so good because the service is absolutely wretched. You'll be ignored for several minutes then treated with surly indifference. But oh, the lattes...

Loved the colors in this place and the patio is sprawling. Lots of dogs outside and it seems like a great community hub where everyone knows each other. 

Coffee was a little watered down, but it did the job and the pastries were delicious. It can feel a little dark and crowded on the inside so not too great for working. Limited outlets too. Overall, an okay place, but not worth regular visits in my opinion
Lola's is top notch in the coffee! The coffee & chocolate chip cookies keep me coming back. Thanks for making a good cup of joe, Lola's!

I came here for a coffee meeting and was SO impressed with the tranquil atmosphere, quality of the coffee, and quaint historic downtown location. I ordered a non-fat vanilla latte and it was the perfect afternoon pick-me-up! If you're in the Downtown Phoenix area and looking to park somewhere and work for a few hours, I highly recommend Lola! It is pretty small inside and they do have outdoor seating so if you're here in the hot summer months, it may not be the best place to choose if the inside seating is taken! I'll be back soon!
The barista was super friendly here! A nice welcome after a long flight. I'm glad I passed up the lengthy Starbucks line to try this place. Iced coffee's not too bad either!
A fun coffee shop within walking distance of my house works great for me. Definitely not the best in the neighborhood but it has a very unique and fun style and I've never had to wait in line.

I absolutely loved this place! The food was great, staff was friendly, and the food came out fairly quickly. I got a breakfast sandwich on a crescent with a side of seasoned breakfast potatoes and a iced chai. The prices are very reasonable and the quality of the food was great. The only downside is that it gets pretty crowded and you might have to compete for seating since you have a lot of people lounging on their computer for a long period of time making it difficult to find an open seat to enjoy your meal.

I make a point of coming here when I'm downtown.  Great place to hang out and get some work done.  I don't drink coffee but great teas and I like their muffins as much as I did the Lola on Camelback.  Not a ton of outdoor seating but I'm usually working inside so not a huge issue for me.  All the girls who work here are great too, very friendly and helpful.  Very cool music too..it's toughto beat this combination of good atmosphere, good staff, good food and good music in a cool, urban, transitioning neighborhood.  Wish I lived closer.
Latte was really good.  Mini pineapple upside down cake was great.  Patio was very cool also.

Better , I think the smiles are cracking through a bit. Keep trying people, a smile helps a great deal. 
Quality food & coffee
Delicious coffee and food, great service and very relaxing ambience. We sat outside on the patio and people had their dogs with them. Really nice.

I have been patronizing Lola's since they were on Central, the first time (then Lux, now pane Bianca). Oh, I have waxed (poetic?) frequently, on how much I bemoan the loss of Lola's Tapas...  

So Lola's closed Tapas and reopened as a coffee shop, and it was good. Then they closed that location (now known as 'The Wrap?') and moved back to Central in the small shopping center housing Twirl and Hulu's (into the location where Tessa's Teas? or a combination antique shop and tea house previously resided for many years). And, it was good. Until, they left. (Two other incarnation coffee shops followed in Lola's wake but it now sits unoccupied.)

This current Lola's location is in a sweet spot next to Pita Jungle and nestled snug in the bustling art district, supported by hipsters and professionals serving the state's capitol (minutes away) and just north of the downtown business district, also adjacent to one of Phoenix's Points of Pride Japanese Gardens and just a nudge farther north, Encanto Park. I do, btw, very much miss the earlier occupant, an Italian deli with a genuine and warm owner. Their wares were SO delectable, especially the rice balls (cant think of what they were called).

Okay, so, this coffee shop sits on Roosevelt and has a large window front facing the very busy street. There is a table with room for five where one can watch the world walk by. The ambiance is rustic and cozy (like Tapas was, oh I so miss it). There is outdoor seating both on the sidewalk next to the street and in back on the patio--dog friendly(!!!). Lots of seating indoors.

They have a skilled baker/cook (quiches, frittatas, tortilla espanolas, etc.). They used to have a STANDARD Rosemary shortbread, yum. I don't visit often anymore but the last many times I've been, the shortbread was not present, sigh.

Patrons include students studying, professionals working, parent(s) with child/ren in tow, or...the likes of me, hanging out.

Back to the location. Lola's shares Roosevelt with Red Hut Coffee (their iced coffee IS good), Tammie Coe's Bakery (excellent baked goods, acceptable coffee), Songbird Coffee (has a similar 'feel' with it's own street side window/seating, great coffee, cool shared space, select baked goods, fun weekend waffles), very nearby is the acclaimed Jobot--respected by peer coffee shop owners along with Cartel, and Fair Trade.

Lola's Coffee bar, on Roosevelt--and, it is good (grin).

Outside C Gates - outside security 

It's pretty good- if your addicted to Starbucks then you won't like it... but it has a nice flavor (nonfat vanilla latte w almond milk) 

Some food choices - a few sandwiches and danishes.

Not busy at all

Fun factoid for the Yelp world.  Lola Coffee occupies a space that was once owned by my great grandfather.  Originally constructed in 1925, The Gold Spot Marketing Center historical building once housed a business owned by my great grandfather called O.T.'s Liquor Store.  He opened it shortly after prohibition was repealed, looking to cash in on a reborn industry.  Downtown was a much different place back then and his business went through good times and bad.  Today there's no sign of the old liquor store, but the bones of The Gold Spot building remain in tact.  And with Downtown back in full swing, the old building houses not only Lola Coffee, but also Pita Jungle, Salon RO5, and The Painters Lounge among other tenants.  

As others have accurately pointed out, this historic space is gorgeous.  Quintessentially Roosevelt Row, molding the bones of an old building with art on the walls, casual furniture, and a modern coffeehouse atmosphere.   Lola can seat around 30 people inside and another 20 or so in the shaded patio out back so there's plenty of room even on busy mornings like this one.  I've been to Lola a few times in the past, but I'm not a coffee drinker and their food offerings had always been limited to whatever baked goods were in the case.  Or so I thought.  I saw they had updated their website recently with an option to make your own custom sandwiches or burritos.  WHAAAAAT?!?!?!  Come Saturday morning, I was here at the opening bell.

My last trip to Lola had been almost two years ago so admittedly I've been out of the loop on a few things.  Like how CRAZY busy this place gets in the morning.  Arriving at 7am, there was already a line of over a dozen folks in front of me, most waiting to get their morning cup o'Joe.  Understandably, the action behind the counter is a beehive of activity as the baristas work double time to keep the line moving (which they do a good job of).  It stayed busy for the first full hour they were open as the line never got shorter than 10 people.  The bakery case was full just as I remembered, but behind the register now hangs a food menu that I hadn't remembered seeing in years past.  That's what I came here to discover.

Along with ordering a small orange juice, I asked to order a breakfast sandwich.  Immediately, the gal at the register handed me a list to fill out so as to customize my meal.  My decisions were as follows:  Sandwich, regular eggs (instead of egg whites) with a medium scramble, ciabatta bread, cheddar and mozzarella cheeses, sausage and bacon meats, tomato and spinach veggies.  Total cost for the small OJ, sandwich, and tax came to $12.  The sandwich took almost 10 minutes so it was a bit of a wait.  But once the kitchen called my name to pickup, I raced over.  What a payoff.  All the ingredients were perfectly cooked and piled high.  They didn't skimp on the meats or the cheeses on this by any measure.  The ciabatta was perfectly toasted and the veggies were melded beautifully into the egg.  Great portion, fantastic flavors, delicious breakfast to start off my Saturday.  

As with any coffeehouse review I can't speak to the coffee as it appears I'm one of the last 30 somethings on Earth that doesn't drink coffee.  That said, the coffee menu here is along the lines of what you'll find at most coffee houses (espressos, cappuccinos, iced coffee, teas, etc).  But the customizable sandwich and burrito menu is truly a treat here.  Lots of ways to make yourself the perfect breakfast or brunch meal, and of course those tasty house-made baked goods in the bakery case up front.  Now that I know Lola offers a full assortment of delicious breakfast items to go with everything else that makes this spot so popular, save me some space on their bandwagon.  My great grandfather would be quite pleased to see his old store reborn into the success story Lola has become.

Living in the area, this is the place to get coffee.  Some of the staff used to be very rude, but upon meeting suzy, a very friendly barista, this place has become our normal coffee spot.  Nice decor, good music, and very good coffee!

Good tasting coffee. I'm impressed because they helped recommend what type of coffee to have, as I'm not a huge coffee enthusiest. 
 Make sure to stop in if only for their German chocolate cake!!

Lola is one of those solid coffee shops that is a destination from just about anywhere in the valley. They're a nice destination for anyone within a few mile radius; walk, run or ride, they keep a bike rack out front.

Pop over whenever you're in the downtown area for better than the average breakfast, quick coffee or tea break, or evening chill session over the weekends. I enjoyed a solid slice of quiche last weekend; although it would have been out of the park with some spinach or veggie added to the recipe. They've also got a selection of pastries to grab, or omlets to order. The wife ordered an eggwhite omlet that was surprisingly yummy!

Heed this suggestion; skip IHOP, Denny's and Coco's and aim for Lola's at breakfast instead.You'll be glad you did.

Happy Dining!

Presenting exquisite pastries and an exceptional cup of the black liquid, you can expect a delicious cup every time. I would live in Portland Park just so I can walk to this place every morning. 

My only issue is of course with how busy this place gets, but who cares, coffee's good, so stand and sip it is.

I've seen Lola Coffee appear recently on one of my favorite blocks in downtown Phoenix. The day I finally set foot in there I was pleasantly surprised and am happy to say Lola Coffee was beyond what I expected, and I was expecting it to be fabulous ;) 

The parking is easy to get in and out of, plus plus! There are two entry ways, one in the front and one in the back. The decor/ambiance of the coffee shop is awesomeness. It is a cluster of rustic, vintage and post modern. The people inside seemed like nice/interesting people reading their morning paper rituals over coffee. The shop is very clean, organized and "pretty". 

The barista and cashier were both very friendly and welcoming. Oh how I love when people making coffee have some extra enthusiasm that rubs off on me and sparks up a positive day for me :) 

The coffee was FRESH. The power of fresh coffee is beyond words :) They have all the essentials to making your own coffee to your preferences. They also have some not-so-ordinary pastries on display that look delicious. 

Overall, I am giving Lola Coffee five stars. I loved the location, the inner setting and the people that work there. Great service and a great commodity! 

Five stars for this Cenpho coffee house :)

I guess I could have gotten an Americano, or maybe now that I am super coffee snobbery, I am always looking for places that do pour overs. However, I ended up getting a medium soy latte here ... and it was ok.

I think Lola is a cute spot, but the parking situation can be a little harrowing because there isn't much of it, and a lot of it is along one way streets so if there aren't any parking spots you end up having to do huge block turns just to get back to where you were before.

There's cute indoor seating where you can definitely work, and I am sure they have wifi of some sort ... but overall I wasn't a huge fan of the lattes because they don't use a dark enough roast with lattes to really bring out the flavor of the coffee. I may come back, but with so many great coffee spots in Phoenix ... I'd skip if this was on your list.

Lola Coffee conveniently located in Downtown Phoenix. This is probably one of my favorite coffee spots! I love the cozy feeling and the location. Every month they change their wall art. I love seeing the different themes every time I come. Also in the front glass wall they have different flowers that are switched up. I love that! It just adds a unique ambiance. 
The coffee is great as well. I usually switch with the cafe blanco, a delicious creamy latte with vanilla in a big mug topped with some beautiful latte art. I also love the matador coffee. I like the sweet combination of chocolate with the espresso. Sometimes I'll get a pastry and the German chocolate cake was moist and very delicious. I always get great customer service when I arrive. The baristas are helpful when you are stuck on what you want to order. I never have a problem with that. The only con to this place is that the seating is limited. I wish Lola was just a tad bit bigger. I love coming here to study especially because it's near ASU downtown campus. I will keep coming here!

How could I forgot exactly how much I love Lola Coffee. I remember this coffee house to meet a friend that lived in the area not long after it opened. So yesterday's visit after work was a joy. I enjoyed a nice cup of coffee in a mug and loved every drop. This was the perfect place to unwind after work rather than the usual Starbucks -- so happy I decided to mix things up and try somethin' different. I'll have to make it a point to try breakfast here. Cheers***

I was traveling in a far away land where a decent cup of coffee was unavailable, I've been to Lola's before and although I failed to provide a review, I knew that they could provide a suitable espresso beverage. I let the man behind the counter know my plight and he suggested El Matador.  I'm sold.  They really provided a stellar cup when I really needed it.  Robust flavor, they listened to my 'not too sweet' request and got it right.
Very cool place in a great corner of downtown Phoenix.  I'm not a caffeine drinker, but their tea was great...love the vibe inside.

Being that this is one of my go to, favorite coffee shops I feel bad that I have not taken the time to give it a review...

-The coffee & espresso are always on point. Best tasting in town in my opinion. Never bitter, consistently just right. 
-The pastries and food and great, made with high quality ingredients. Be mindful though, that their delicious breakfast burritos are only served until 11am, learned that the hard way one day ;)
-The baristas in general are a bit slow to warm, but once you start frequenting, they recognize you & make you feel glad to be a repeat customer. 
-The owner sometimes works as barista and when he does he always does it with a warm smile.
