-The space is historically hip. I'm a fan of original brick, and I love the local artist's displays. My favorite area to sit is in front of the window facing Roosevelt St. The patio seating in the back is great especially in Phoenix Fall/Winter/Spring :)
-Neighbors Pita Jungle, another excellent choice when you're in the mood for a meal. 

All around, love Lola.

The location of this little hot spot is in perhaps the hippest, most beautiful section of downtown Phoenix. Almost a European feel for the sectioned town and courtyard it is in - right next to Pita Jungle.   Love everything about this place except for one thing... If you plan on staying, it is perhaps the noisiest coffee spot on planet earth.  Still, that said, you need to go... Great coffee and wonderful homemade food.

If you're going to be choosing between Starbucks or here on the concourse outside of security I would say the drinks here are awesome.  And maybe I should push this higher, but the service after the coffee was made was really rough. 

Let's get to the borgia...it was an Orange and Chocolate mocha...so yes that means double chocolate and the orange hit the spot right where it needed to as I was waiting for my girlfriend to pick me up.

Great coffee and great prices. A spacious inside and tables out back are just the beginning. This coffee house is the place to chill on a nice afternoon. The staff seems genuinely happy and pleased to explain their different options. Service is quick, too.

The coffee itself is rich and flavorful. It is fresh tasting, and they offer all variety of swetening options, including raw sugar. The portions are reasonable, and drinks not just loaded with milk and syrup.

If you are looking for a place to relax and catch up on your emails without feeling alone or rushed, this is it. Warning: you might become a regular!

Love love love. The atmosphere is great, the coffee is phenom. Will be coming back very soon.
The patio is to die for.

Great coffee and great selection of greets. Their Chai Tea Latte was SOOOOO GOOD. Coffee Latte was also delicious. They have a cute outside area to chill and have your coffee. From the back area use door with the 6 on it. Clearly all the drinks were delicious finished everything!!

I love Lola's coffee!  The space is amazing and the people there are very friendly.  Their pastries are good as well!  I love my coffee and the thing I hate the most is when you go to a coffee shop and each time you have a different experience... each time I have been to Lola's it has always been the same, great!!!

I posted a review of Lola after my first visit and was asked to take it down because some people thought it was too harsh.

I've given it four chances now.

And I have to say, I am disappointed with Lola. I have been on the hunt for a chill coffeehouse in my neighborhood, where you can work and sip coffee, and occasionally chat with your neighbors. I live in right on Roosevelt Street and was hoping Lola would be that ... but it really lacks the ambiance I am looking for. The coffee was alright. The espresso shots tasted like they were burnt. The croissant I had was dried out. 

But the vibe is what was really lacking for me. I left after 45 minutes. I would rather be in my own house ... in my own space. I think the owner was in when I came in once and he didn't even make eye contact or greet customers ... nothing. I think that's why Lola is lacking an authentic vibe.

It is an intimate space, and the decor is nice, but being in there puts me in a bad mood. Too many wannabe hipsters and pretenders - and that includes the inappropriately dressed and overly tattooed baristas behind the counter. OK, you've got fake boobs, we see them already. I don't need to see them so intimately. You may also want to get a pair of jeans that fit so I don't have to see five inches of butt crack while you're getting my coffee. And dudes, having ink doesn't make you hip. Being able to be engaging and interesting makes you hip. And the sour looks don't help.

I REALLY want to like Lola, but every experience I've had at Lola has been full of the attitude that I hope to avoid in an independent coffee shop. 

Very disappointing.
Lola's "Blanco" is seriously the best white mocha I've ever had. They've got chill service, great coffee, and keep the place nice and clean. It's a good spot to meet friends or whatever...

I love Lola. Great tasting coffee and pastries. Really low-key atmosphere with a low-key, yet pleasant, staff. It's a bit small, but in a hardly-noticeable sort of way. The furniture positioning and mellow vibe keep even a small crowd cool and copacetic. I look forward to returning.

Live near by, but have never stopped in.  Glad I did today. The iced coffee was refreshing, along with a sweet peanut butter cookie that was both moist and flavorful.  Really like the ambiance with the big front window seating that is shaded enough to work on my laptop by the window.  Great mix of seating options for working, meeting, or chatting with a friend.  Good stop for any reason.  Only thing that took me a minute to figure out was where to park.  A little more directional signage would help.
I like this place for all of its outside real estate, I don't like the cups they put your cappacino in.

Went for our first visit while in town staying at the found:re

Great coffee, great food, friendly quick service. They have a cute back patio we sat on while enjoying the beautiful morning. 

Thanks, well be back

Some times the little things make the biggest differences. In this case it was the Agave nectar.

I am not a huge coffee person due to my aversion to caffeine but I was thirsty and was just next door for lunch. I was happy to hear they can decaf just about any drink.

I went with a basic iced decaf american 16 oz for $2.50 seemed like a decent deal. 

With the agave nectar and creamer at the dressings station it was quite good.

The place has a real down town hipster feel with a retro sound system and tables that match the macs that people are using.
Tasty caramel almond milk latte. I really like that they put 2 shots in a small, nice and strong.

Very fun and open atmosphere with awesome baristas!

The three of us were just walking around the area when we spotted this place.  My little cutie pie had the strawberry Italian soda with cream and whipped topping he really liked.  The barista gave him a complimentary cookie, so sweet.  We also had to have some chocolate cupcakes!   I had the chai latte.  I wish I had gotten a coffee drink instead with all the good reviews about it.  There's always a next time.  Hubby clearly enjoyed his latte.  It was a beautiful day, so we got our drinks to go.  We'll have to bring our group and plant our butts  to enjoy the place next time.  I noticed some pastries and other hot food items that looked wicked good too.
Great location, cool place, nice courtyard. Not to mention coffee :) and pastries.

Loooooove Lola's. I repeat I love Lola's. The tiny coffee shop located in the historic area of downtown Phoenix has the best coffee in the valley. I'm hooked on the chocolate coffee. My afternoon treat that keeps me going. Nice tiny shop to meet a friend or chill alone. Dining inside and outside while you munch on their fresh baked goods.

I highly recommend this tasty coffee shop if you need to meet someone downtown. This is definitely the go-to spot. Support this local business you will not regret it.

I'm pretty critical of coffee shops and this one was contemporary, crowded, and not at all exciting. It's in a nice, manufactured part of town so I was surprised this was on the list of suggestions from my hip Airbnb hosts. The coffee was standard. The crowd was mostly businesspeople. It's not a place I would come to again.
The baristas here make magic happen! Wonderful drinks with very little wait, even with a line.
After traveling to Europe nothing has come close, until now! the coffe  truly has the essence of rich and delicious flavourful coffee only found abroad.

Ok. This is my local Lola. 

My only real complaint is that the staff is pretty rude (unlike my experience at Uptown), unfriendly and make me feel pretty unwelcome. I'm a regular so that's pretty dissapointing. The staff is constantly talking amoungst themselves.

Because of this, I felt displaced. But I settled in at the main table and tried to study. I ordered a cupcake and LOVED IT. And the orange juice is AMAZING.

Minus:
- Rude staff
- Uncomfy chairs
- Lackluster hours
- No punch card/discounts offered

Plus:
- Quality
- Wi-Fi
- Atmosphere
- Location

While I want a balance of friendliness and personal space, I also want someone to crack a smile so atleast I feel appreciated for patronizing their business.

Lola Coffee has awesome baked goods.

I love myself some coffee and espresso but rarely do I really try a place's bakery simply because I don't think its going to be worth it. Don't make that mistake here cause we bought a slice of Zucchini Walnut Bread (or something, I'll admit I forget exactly) and we loved it. It kinda tasted like Life cereal which was crazy but went well with my Matador Latte. My girlfriend ordered a Green Tea lemonade by request and that was crazy good too. 

On a previous visit I had tried a Matador Espresso. Essentially a flavored shot of espresso I was really pleased. I make this mistake a lot where I get "ordering anxiety" so I order an espresso usually leaving me wishing I had gotten something else but the Matador Espresso is really good and although I was still thirsty I didn't feel like I let myself down with this choice.

Their beans are pretty good too, good choice if you need some but there are other places in the area to get beans that I would prefer.

It appears as well that they have fresh fruit available too which often is missing from most coffee shops I've visited in the Valley. 

Go to Lola!

I stop here everyday, when I can. The "Matador" is the best coffee drink on the planet, it makes my coworker go in to this berzerker frenzy. Like a Mexican Cornholio. The chocolate croissant is the best thing I have ever put in my mouth. There was one left the other day, and I almost slapped the shit out of this old lady for taking it before me.

I live a mere three blocks from this wonderful place, yet I've only been twice.  Don't ask me why, though, because I don't have a good answer.  Both visits were very nice.  More than nice, actually.  On each occasion, I was met by different baristas.  Both were super-friendly and chatted with me while they prepared my order.  It's a very refreshing change of pace when you meet a stranger who seems genuinely nice and makes you feel like they actually like you.  Lola's employees make me feel this way.

I'm the sort of person who will frequent a business with great customer service even if the goods they offer aren't the best.  At Lola, I get both!  On my first visit, I ordered a Cafe Au Lait and some sort of decadent cupcake.  Both were extremely tasty.  Today's coffee was a latte, I believe, with caramel and white chocolate.  So, so good.  Mind you, I know nothing about coffee except that I generally hate Starbucks and prefer my coffee light and sweet.  And bonus? A raspberry bar on the house.  It was one of the best raspberry bars I've ever had.

The other night, I took a friend to another local favorite coffee house.  I'm looking forward to taking him to Lola next time we hang out.  And I'll definitely be stopping by Lola more frequently on my own!

Best vanilla latte I have had thus far and I have tried many of the Valley's hottest coffee joints. Lola's vanilla latte was perfectly balanced between the sweet of the vanilla, creaminess of the milk, and bitterness of the coffee. I was in heaven! The only downside to Lola's for me was the lack of pastries. It's kind of disappointing when such a great coffee place doesn't have much of a food scene to accompany it. However, if you're just looking for a great cup of coffee with no snack- this place is so killer!

It's the perfect location to wait for the international flight arrivals. The ambiance is nice, though the music is too loud. My iced tea is good enough. The service is their big downfall. I waited 15 minutes (I got sidetracked people watching) for my drink which is unacceptable.

Hands down best coffee in town. Yep there, I said it. Heck lets say it again - the BEST coffee in town I l mean come on, whats to say, I clearly love everything about this place. Its is basically everything you want in a coffee shop, locally owned, knowledgeable staff,  excellent wifi (cuz lets be honest, how else is work getting done) comfortable seating, excellent location (even if parking can be a minor nuisance) and coffee that is just phenomenal. Hang on, coffee that is phenomenal consistently ! They roast their own coffee onsite and so you know what you are getting is quiet honestly as fresh as it gets. 

Heres 2 parting pro tips : 

Get the largest size possible. Why ? Because every darn drink is so damn sinfully delicious why would you deprive yourself? Self denial is over rated when it comes to coffee. 

They are now open in terminal 4, so buy your beans from there and you dont have to deal with baggage issues, cuz you know you are buying more than just one, i mean you do have friends dont you ? Yep, you're welcome.

Not really my scene... Sitting really close to everyone on their laptops.. A little too reminiscent of lux. The coffee was fine, better than Starbucks it not as good as lux of fa me caffe. Parking really difficult. Not my favorite spot.

You have a fill out a request form when you order a breakfast sandwich...wait..did you just read that correctly...yes..you did...a form...with an official blue inked pen...while everyone else in the line behind you watches....

the coffee was great though..

Coffee and service are superb ! 

The pastry selection is small but delicious. The place is small but there is outside seating. I love the cozy feel of this place. The servers are friendly and make a great cup of joe.

Stopped by because I wanted good coffee and a killer vibe. Needless to say, Lola Coffee did not disappoint- really embodied the artsy hipster feel radiating from the Roosevelt area. I had the Matador (cold) and was actually very impressed with the mix of flavors- cinnamon, espresso, and hot chocolate. The whipped cream on top was delicious and actually had a taste of mocha. I also ordered the chocolate chip banana bread and was unfortunately not as impressed. It was a little dry/stale (by 10AM) and the chocolate sort of took away from the banana part of the bread. Next time I'll have to try the chocolate croissant, which is apparently amazing. On the last note, I thought the prices were extremely affordable: small cold matador, medium Americano, a decent sized choco banana bread for $11
luuuuuuvvvvvv the coffee! and the prices are great even on the pasteries! I meet many clients there and quickly becoming their favorite spot as well!
It's ok the coffee does not have bang if you say well you should try their flavor drinks well it takes away from the true coffee

Relax and enjoy

Today, I stopped in at Lola Coffee to grab a latte and something sweet to eat. This was my first visit to Lola's Coffee  and I really enjoyed myself.  Lola has a nice coffee shop feel; with large tables, oversized stuffed couches, newspapers, and magazines. Hoaever, if you prefer to sit outside Lola's also offers a nice outdoor seating area.

I liked that Lola's was busy with people constantly coming and going and I really enjoyed my caramel latte and Pastry, which was fresh and delicious.

Friendly staff, great coffee, tasty pastries, and inviting atmosphere (a bit small but nonetheless great.) What more can you ask for. So if you're ever in the area, you should stop by you will not be disappointed.

What a great find!  Very friendly staff and the decor inside and outside is on point.  Oh, and their coffee is amazing too! We did get a cinnamon mocha, a cafe au lait and some sparkling water to compliment our caffeinated beverages.  We definitely go back when we are in the area. And I believe there is another one in the Sky Harbor Airport.

Let me just say, my friends would tell you, I am a coffee snob. 
I used to go to LUX way before they stuffed it full of furniture and became way too popular. (Hello, this is phoenix, can you offer some shade?) BUT now there is Lola Coffee and I can't remember the last time I went to LUX.
The first time I went to this location I was instantly reminded of my favorite Portland coffee, stumptown. I love the fact that you can smell the coffee roasting as you get near. It just has a great vibe and has decorated in true minalmalist fashion (yes, lux, this is what it looks like) My favorite drink is the iced coffee, they put 2 shots of espresso in there, and I didn't even ask, Thank you! The pastries are always top notch as well. I am still in shock that someone said their coffee is no better than Starbucks. Have some respect, geesh!
Pretty tasty cup of coffee and you can beat their delicious baked goodies!  I love the raspberry muffin, nice flavor and not overly sweet!

I drive 35mikes one way just for their amazing house coffee. It's an espresso blend that will have your taste buds buzzing. It's a small local shop, so be prepared for a good size crowd and don't forget to try a chocolate croissant too.

Automatically downgraded by one star due to its early closing time of 7 pm on weeknights.

Very cool space, cool vibe, great location, good music. Loved everything about it but the knowledge that, as a downtowner who works ex-downtown, I'll never have the chance to come again when I'm not on vacation or unemployed.

Lola is my go-to for morning perks and for a place to do my weekend work. From the incredibly helpful staff who are as gracious as they come, to the eclectic music mix, the rotation of art on the walls, and the mixed clientele, Lola is the coffee space of my dreams. Even when traveling to cities such as San Francisco, Austin, And the best of the Midwest and East Coast, Lola sets the standard for me about everything a coffee shop should be. You can tell there is definite pride in ownership, and Daniel's impeccable taste is evident in every detail.

I love the vibe of this place. I've gotten work done here and have met friends to catch up. The baked goods are delicious and the coffee is some of the best I have ever tried. It's right by a historic neighborhood, so I love walking around the area.

Lola, I would like to know what on earth you put in your coffee! It resembles only one other coffee I've had and that was in Portland. Lola, you put something in your coffee that sends a spark of energy to my brain and makes me work like a madwomen for the rest of the day! 

I really like this location. It has a lot of character and reminds me of a coffee shop I'd find in Portland or SF. It's not huge inside, but everyone seems to coexist comfortably together and it's an easy spot to have a meeting or do some work. 

They put something delicious and addicting in their iced coffee. I ordered the non-fat iced vanilla latte and I was happy for the rest of the day. The coffee was creamy, not too strong and perfectly chilled. I could have had four more but that would have been bad news. 

I will dream about coffee beans until my next visit for that addicting iced latte.

I dont drink coffee. If i did i might choose a place with hipster art, a cute girl named Joanna at the register who knows everyones name, and a coffee roaster in the back that you can see.

This place is a little piece of Haight and ashbury in the middle of phoenix. Very cool music, cool atmosphere and the soy chai latte was excellent.

The environment is great on a Saturday morning, people were laid back eating breakfast, conversing, some were on there laptop doing some school work.  On top of that my coffee was delightful I ordered a iced cafe mocha with coconut milk and no whip! Sooooooooooo satisfied for a morning on my way to work. Great place, great environment, great coffee!!!
There are four places I can trust to make great coffee in Phoenix. Lola's is one of them. Nuff Said.

I've loved Lola's since it was located on Central, just south of Camelback. The newer location (Roosevelt and 3rd) is a bit smaller, but the quality of the coffee and snacks is still always excellent. 

Their iced tea is excellent, but I'm always a sucker for their Matador - a mocha with cinnamon syrup that is out of this world good. They don't always ask you if you want whipped cream, but you're really missing out on something special if you don't get it! 

Parking can be a challenge, but if you drive a but north in the lot, you can park in the covered garage which is only for customers of the spots in the area.
Absolutely better. All of the staff are very friendly, highly professional and proud of their craft. Has a beautiful patio and an ideal atmosphere.

Lola is best known for their coffee.  Overall, I thought it was pretty good, but for all the rave my friends were telling me about; I thought it was okay at best.  

I think Lola's is a cool place to hangout and chill, but I didn't care too much about the food and overall pastries.   I ordered their breakfast sandwich which I included spinach, cheddar cheese, and bacon on a ciabatta bread.  I love ciabatta bread and everything else within my sandwich, but there was nothing really spectacular about it.  I had to dabble some hot sauce to add some moisture to it so that I may swallow it!  

Needless to say, I think Lola Coffee is still a very cool place to hangout for some coffee and free WiFi haha! - Enjoy!

I ordered oatmeal and it came out so drowned in cream / milk that it was cold and soup like. When I returned it to the register girl and explained how bad it was she just blankly stared at it - absolutely clueless on how to handle a situation like this just I returned to my seat outside and within 2 min we had to leave because there was a terrible smoke fire that pummeled out from the kitchen onto the patio. Everyone pretty much evacuated. Oh and my coffee was burnt. Get it together guys.

Lola embodies what supporting local businesses is all about! They have put together a first rate business that consistently serves GREAT coffee and offers a fine selection of pastries.

The atmosphere is awesome with large windows facing the street that let in plenty of sunlight. Awesome tunes are always playing and I particularly dig the retro stereo. I always pop in just before work so I have yet to spend time and soak up the atmosphere, but this is a local business that Phoenix can be proud of.

me likes. the coffee is goooood. love the matador with that amazing cinnamon whipped cream.... do yourself a favor and get it in all it's full fat glory.

there is plenty of seating here, but not for parties larger than 5. it's actually quite hopping early in the morning which makes it difficult for conversations as it gets pretty loud (8:30-9:30am), but dies down a bit after that.

love the barista and the cashier (courtney) - so sweet!

the only drawbacks... the baked goods are kinda meh. i like the homemade thing goin' on, but... the scones are SO hard, and the quiche had a souffle-y texture that i didn't care for. 

summary: get. the. whipped. cream. and maybe a lil coffee to go with that.

Downtown Phoenix is always tricky when it comes to finding a good spot to plop down and do some work while enjoying a good cup of joe.  You won't be the only ones to do that at Lola's.  It's the perfect spot for it.

Why go there:  The wi-fi is as hot and ready as the coffee and most importantly, the pastries (because caffeinated beverage all need a sidekick).  For the most part the pastries look to be made in house.  That's aways a plus.  The atmosphere is good, even when busy it doesn't feel like you don't belong, sometimes local hangout spots can make you feel like that.  Friendly ladies behind the bar.

Don't miss: The croissants, or anything made with that very same dough... and the patio (on a beautiful cooler Phoenician day).

Overall: A good variety of coffee and pastries to go with your coffee, this place isn't overly hipster in other words, it's not pretentious, it's kept simple and real.

I now have this new habit of trying out at least one local coffee shop whenever I travel to a new city and Lola Coffee was one of the top Yelp search results near the downtown Phoenix area. Later I learned that there is actually another Lola Coffee located in Terminal 4 of the Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport. Overall this is a small (enough to fit about 25+ customers inside the cafe) and cozy coffee shop with free WiFi and multiple wall outlets. It was a bit crowded when our group got during the weekend, but there were few tables still available.

A bag of coffee beans is $14 per lb and the drink menu also has other non-coffee drinks such as fresh OJ, lemonade, and hot chocolate.

***

Matador (cinnamon-spiced mocha - $4): It had an unique aftertaste with pretty smooth finish. The drink was slightly sweeter than I would prefer, but it was a pretty decent drink.

***

It is no Philz Coffee, but I was pretty happy with my drink and I am a fan of this coffee shop.

P.S. - Please watch the step at the front entrance.

Lola can do no wrong. Love the atmosphere, the brew, the food, and the location. It's funny to me that people always talk about Lux, which the owner of Lola created and sold, and which is now more pretense than substance, IMO.

Lola is friendly, cool, and awesome coffee. If you're craving something sweet, the Cafe Caramel with homemade whipped cream is unforgettable. Baked goods out of this world, made in house.

I wish it were slightly cheaper, so that I could go more and not feel guilty, but alas.

Lola Coffee is one of my favorite coffee shops in Phoenix! I thought they closed a while back and was so thrilled to learn that they opened again on 3rd Ave. I don't live nearby so it's a treat when I make my way down to their cute brick cafe. My favorite coffee at Lola is the matador - hot chocolate with cinnamon and espresso. I love to order it as a cappuccino with lots of foam. The quality of the coffee is so much better than the big box stores, and it's what makes the trip down here worth it. The staff is always so friendly and the patio is a comfortable and cozy place to enjoy a weekend morning, with a little succulent garden and tiny finches flitting about. Lola Coffee is just about the definition of weekend goals.

Out of all the local coffee shops, this is one of my favorite. First, and most importantly, the coffee is great! It has a nice rich flavor, but isn't bitter. If you are looking for something a little sweeter, I recommend the Matador (along w/ the 50 other people here have).

Secondly, there is some pretty delicious food. I really like the quiche the best.

Third, the staff is always nice.

Lastly, it's a cool environment. If you're looking for a cool place to hang out, this is a good spot.

Lola Coffee does it again!

Already open approximately three weeks... and I didn't even realize that Lola had gone into this location (previously Calabria I believe).  I guess that shows how much time I spend in Downtown Phoenix.  (Not enough!)  The Gold Spot building that houses this Lola location has a lot of character and I especially love that there is plenty of parking in the area.  I also like that there is both indoor and outdoor seating.  

And the reason that I'm giving this location four stars instead of just three? They have the best barista in town!  Jensy (formerly of Mama Java) is employed here.  While I had an iced tea today, I know first hand that Jensy makes damn good soy lattes!

Now, if I don't get stood up for a meeting during my next visit to this Lola location, my experience will be even better!

A cute little quaint coffee house nestled in downtown Phoenix! Although small, the inside offers many comfortable seating options. I had a double espresso and the taste was awesome and bold, just like it should be. The staff is friendly and made me feel welcomed. :)

This my favorite coffeehouse in Phoenix. It combines excellent coffee, coffee culture, a great space, and good service.

Daniel Wayne is no stranger to the coffee business. He has worked in Phoenix, studied in Italy, started a coffee business in Seattle and two in Phoenix. I really think he is has a superb palate, respect for tradition while not shunning the modern, and a great eye for style. He is also very humble and gracious. His roasting style shows evidence of having spent time in Italy: not afraid of caramelization and a clear focus on balance + complexity. Daniel is a fine barista and I always ask him to make my drink, if he is at the store.

Coffee culture is definitely apparent. From the espresso machine to the roaster seen clearly through a window in the seating area, it is a place serious about coffee without being overbearing.

The space is outstanding. First of all it is "real place". It was an old market, I think and has perfect light, due to its orientation, windows, and high ceiling. Daniel pulls together an eclectic assemblage of vintage chairs, drafting tables, a glass door for a menu, and an old school console stereo w giant dorm speakers. The elements work together to make a relaxing urban space. Daniel plays vinyl and we both are huge Cat Stevens fans. He played the "Tea for the Tillerman" album for me on my last visit, which made my day.

Not sure why they get slammed for service. I have always been treated well by all of the staff. They may not have the "may I take your order, please" smiley service attitude, but are respectful and kind. It is a great place to hang out for hours or just get well crafted espresso drink and a pastry.
Lola's is by far the best coffee shop in Phoenix. Their service, baked goods, breakfast and coffee are exceptional.

Word on the street was that Lola had what I wanted so I went to go if it was true.
Lola Coffee is a cute a little shop off 3rd Ave and Roosevelt, it has a hipster kind of vibe, but don't judge Lola by that.

When you walk in you see the menu on the board on the wall and you see beautifully displayed pastries and treats in front of you, and I even learned that these lovely looking sweets are all made in house, that's pretty neat!

After checking out the board I went for a large Caf√© Caramel with whipped cream on top. 1st off let me tell you, this is freshly made whipped cream, it was perfectly sweet and a perfect addition to my coffee. The coffee itself, well that was delish and just what my day needed. 

Glad to have stumbled upon Lola's Coffee and looking forward to trying some of the pastries soon too.

Lola's is far and away one of the top 3 coffee shops in Arizona let alone PHX. And when I say top 3 it's more like a 3 way tie for first. 

What makes them number one... The pastries, espresso Con Panna, and the staff!

I was really really disappointed. The pre-made food was.over priced and simply horrible. My iced tea had something floating in it. When I told the clerk, she seemed.oblivious about it. Ugh, stay away!

There are very few places I can wander into and meet people I know well, each from a different personal life zone of mine.  Lola on Roosevelt is one of them.  A true "3rd place" I suppose - especially since I live over 6 miles away.

The coffee is chosen, roasted, ground and cooked with the obsessive passion that we've known and loved the past 10 years at all 4 "3rd places" - Lux, Lola Tapas, Lola on Central and now here.  The barristas are elegantly poised professionals who can handle crowd "spikes" calmly and rapidly - a very rare and precious talent [why is it done in these places so consistently?].  The confections have always been excellent - I wish the grains weren't so highly refined is my only quibble there.  

The old building is just perfect!  What they've done to it makes the space achingly exquisite.  And comfortable.  And comfortingly urbane.

I wish I lived next door.

Obs, a great location in the quaint Gold Spot next to the soon-to-be Pita Jungle. I really like what they did with the space. The vintage elementary school chairs bring me back to the days of learning cursive and pasting cotton balls on paper to create a snowman. Lots of natural light, too! The coffee is spot on, and they have pastries as well. -1 star for not having a punch card. They need to get on that!

I actually have not ordered anything from here but I have to give it 5 stars for the sheer number of men that are there way early in the morning working on their laptops not dressed in shorts and t-shirts, slumming but actually hair combed and professionally dressed. 
Is this the new trend now?  To get office dressed to work remotely from a coffee shop. A single woman's dream spot to casually hang out to meet a guy!  Lol. I'm not kidding. 
If any of you single gals take my advice and start hanging out there (make sure you are also dapper and made up) after reading this review and snag a nice guy, well, I'm Chinese and love being a matchmaker so don't forget to send me a message with a little "wink" "wink". No need to share details. 
I'm sure the coffee is good here for that kind of intel, read the other reviews. 
Like I've already wrote, I didn't get any coffee or pastry there. And I'm sure the decor was nice but I didn't really notice. Nonetheless, thanks for the pick me up- the eye candy kind!!! XO

Great food and service, love the location. 
This place is almost always busy, though sometimes I can get in there mid to late afternoon during a slow-down. 

I often get the iced tea and try a baked good.  The bakery items vary from day to day.  I've tried cornbread, cookies, and an apple tart - all very delicious.  

You can purchase coffee beans here too.   

There's free wifi, plenty of tables and rows of seats for us loners who like to just sit, sip, snack and work on the laptop.

The owner of this location is amazing and I can tell he cares deeply about his establishment.  This review is only based on the type of customer service I received through email and how quick he was to respond to my question regarding another location.  Given how prompt he was I could tell that coming into this restaurant the staff will have a great environment and no bad vibes at all the way a business should be.  I have yet to try out this location but I most definitely will have to go soon just to see for myself and update my review to add on to this.

The medium latte I ordered here is on my top ten list of the best I've ever had.  Most lattes are more milky than espresso flavored, but the latte at Lola was rich with espresso yet still creamy and milky.  There is an adorable little patio out back with plenty of shade where you can enjoy your coffee.  We ordered a chocolate chip cookie as well that was soft and full of chocolate.  I would be interested to try some more of their pastry items.
If you are looking for a specialty coffee shop, this is not the place to go. Denny's breakfast coffee quality. Cool shop though.

I'm giving it 3 stars almost solely on decor & atmosphere. 

After reading all of the rave reviews I really expected to be amazed, but sadly, that didn't happen. 

I did get a nonfat chai latte instead of coffee, so maybe that has something to do with it. It was kind of bland, nothing special :( 

But like I said, the company was good, the atmosphere nice & I love the look of the place :) 

If I try it again I'll try the coffee,,, I don't think I want to repeat my chai experience.
Matador is fabulous! I'm enjoying a cup of iced green tea at the moment and it's not too shabby.

The cappuccino I ordered was made with pure perfection by the multiple tasking, personable barista. The music was the perfect addition to the cozy eclectic vibe of this place. I will without a doubt be frequenting Lola's often!

Lola, who can say something bad about it? But I won't give them five based on a detail: A female casher this morning. I'm a morning person, and I started the small talk, she seemed bothered by my comments, it was almost like she was being forced into politeness (if you're gonna fake it make sure it's credible). At the end I even complimented the barista's art work, but she (the same cashier) responded with a rather cold "have nice day" answer. I try not to take things personal, but improvement in that area is always a good thing. Having said that, I've always been treated very well by other baristas, and their coffee and pastries are very good...and that is why I can't give them less stars.

Great lattes!!! And great service. We visited around 12 coffee shops within 2-3 weeks of visiting Az. Lola is one that we will rate top notch. When you roast your own beans, makes a huge difference. It's like baking your Bread in house.
I think this place is too rich and delicious and expensive for people who have a relationship (like a wife and kids or whatever).  So I'm single.

Sweets are so delicious here! Seating was a bit uncomfortable and it can be crowded. Outside seating is quaint and kind of reminds me of European coffee shops that spill over into the streets. Didn't have good drink options for caffeine-free, but it is definitely worth a visit if you drink caf√©!

Decent, not the best. I noticed after coming here twice that the espresso tastes a little burnt. Lattes are very sweet and when I asked for mine to be remade the baristas weren't the sweetest. The second drink tasted a lot better.

This is my favorite coffee shop in the downtown Phoenix area. The prices are moderately inexpensive and it feels like a little family when I go in. The drinks are delicious and the food is to die for!
Great coffee and great breakfast food. The quiche was amazing. A great neighborhood spot, clearly popular with the locals.

I'm going on a coffee tour of Phoenix and the surrounding areas.  So far, I've been to 6 places and this has been my 2nd favorite in terms of the coffee taste (2nd to Lux).  My drink of choice is iced mocha and it was delicious.  It was hard to find parking, but the inside was much better than Lux for some reading.   The coffee was delish & service was friendly!

Loved the cute and communal atmosphere, disappointed in the coffee. 

Arrived around 10 am on a Friday and the place was hopping. Every single seat was taken and it was raining outside, so the outdoor patio was a no-go. Like an idiot, I ordered my coffee to stay and then had to stand and drink it in the back of the shop.

The staff was aloof and cold and not exactly welcoming to an obvious out of towner. It's not the most friendly of places, but maybe they were just having an "off" day due to the yucky weather. 

There was a general sense of chaos and unpleasantness behind the counter. Since it was so crowded and the baristas were on the slower side, there was a huge bottleneck of customers just standing around near the front register that made it difficult to order and to move about. 

I ordered a cappuccino and it was just okay, with a slightly burned and over-roasted flavor to the beans. I had to add chocolate powder to top it off to try to mask the taste (The Horror! The Horror!)! Maybe Phoenix residents don't know what a good coffee is, but this wasn't it. 

I hate to rag on a local business, but I don't want any first wave / hipster coffee lovers to waste their time because you will be disappointed. I certainly was.
Awesome cappuccino, oh the the chocolate chip cookie w sea salt was the bomb!  The outside back patio is super cute!

I stopped here before going through security at the airport. They do their iced coffee with a double shot of espresso and it was exactly the amount of caffeine I needed! The poppy seed muffin was also very good. The barista was friendly and attentive. Overall great experience and I will be checking out the location downtown.

This time I had their orange bread..... MMMMMMM like home made!! 

And again a latte! just like the way they know how to serve it!!

I love it for the ambiance, big windows, tea (Numi organic) with free refills, giant cookies, quiche, couches and art books. A lovely space with a chill vibe perfect for studying or socializing. Just around the corner is the Japanese Friendship Garden, a beautiful place.

Been here a couple of times, the last time was last Sunday 09/25/2016 and I like the location and the coffee. The first time (Early August)  was there their Credit Card Machine broke and the Girl was very apologetic. This time, the gentleman behind the counter was also nice and the barista working the espresso machine was quick to get my drink. The store is clean, WiFi is also available though I did not use it.

This place STINKS!! My hair, and clothes reek of BURNT coffee!!! The coffee made my friend gag, literally! There was smoke in the air inside and outside this place! I can still smell the bitterness and I'm now 20 miles away!!!
For the same price I could go to starbucks. I didn't see the wow factor here. It's convenient for the people who live at Roosevelt square.

I found myself at Lola's Coffee because I was sluggish, and needing some coffee to fight off a food coma so that I could continue to enjoy my visit to Phoenix.  Google Maps done me right, all this time.

It's in a quaint location off of 3rd street, and I imagine if I lived remotely nearby, I could envision myself spending a lot of time lounging out at Lola's, because I ironically like a lot of the same aesthetics that hipsters do, despite being somewhat of a jock type.  But it's a clean and relaxing interior design with plenty of chairs, couches, and lots of reading materials while you partake in your coffee.

I'll be honest, the matador I had was pretty good, but in the end, still kind of forgettable.  Not quite the life-changing I must come back to PHX for this kind of cup of joe.  But still good.  The cookie I got was a little on the oily side, but still edible.

I give the place four stars, because I like the atmosphere, the two-toned girl who served me my coffee was a total fox, and the coffee was still good.  Phoenix as a whole is full of great eateries and coffee joints, and Lola's on 3rd easily fits in with the rest of them.
A rare, quiet spot near downtown with delicious coffee and friendly people. Always stop in here after Pita Jungle. Free parking in the garage next door!
The best coffee shop around. Love the taste of their coffee exactly what I was looking for. Too bad it's too far away from me. I wish they would open more locations of north.

Great little coffee shop in downtown phoenix. Love the atmosphere and the people here. The coffee tastes great and it is much quieter and personal than lux coffee. I prefer this place a lot more. 
I love the decorations and the coffee is good on my tongue. ;)

Went here yesterday and got a medium iced coffee. It tasted burnt and I couldn't even drink half of it. I was excited to try this place as I'm from out of town and saw the reviews, but this coffee was not good.
I'm from Chicago and had my best cup coffee here at Loa. I recommend the Matador, you should also check out the cool art on the walls while getting caffeine in your bloodstream!

Lola is exactly what I look for in a coffee shop. Not too big, but plenty of seating, an abundance of Wifi, super cute decor, nice people, and of course the coffee is always good (my poison being the Cafe Blanco). It's a downtown Phoenix gem. I would recommend it to anyone and will keep coming back for more.

Hands down, this is my favorite coffee shop in all of Arizona. I crave it when I am away, even though I buy the espresso beans to make lattes at home. While having the beans at home is wonderful, it just isn't the same as having a barista at Lola's hand-craft my beverage. My favorite is a large iced vanilla latte because it isn't too sweet and the espresso is strong. Their pastries are amazing and ever changing. I've had a chocolate cupcake, a slice of German Chocolate Cake, and a gingerbread cookie. All of them delicious! Huge props to their baker.

The location is downtown, which can be a hassle to get to, but it's worth it. The inside is on the small and intimate side, which can both be a blessing and a curse. Thankfully, they have a nice patio outside, which is great when the weather permits.

Overall, I love Lola Coffee. If you love coffee, then you'll love it too. I cannot recommend it enough.

Was in town for the weekend and wanted to try a local coffee joint that was walking distance from our hotel. Lola did not disappoint! My iced latte was perfect and hit the spot! I also snagged a piece of their zucchini walnut bread because it looked so good....and it was amazing! The staff is friendly and overall has a good vibe.

Lola's Coffee is better than Fair Trade Coffee (4 blocks away). Other than that, it's just a coffee shop, nothing more, nothing less. 

One couch, two comfy chairs a table and the rest are rather ridged metal chairs. The high ceiling gives the place a airy if not vacant feel. 

They do have lots of space for laptops and lots of outlets to go with.

The coffee is ... well ... it's coffee. Nothing outstanding nothing horrible, but it doesn't come anywhere near the awesomeness of Lux or Conspire. 

The the biggest complaint I have is they only have ONE set of stereo speakers so the music comes from one area of the room and just bounces around the single room venue.

Standard coffee choices, but the hand writing on the menu is hard to read. The pastries that accompany the variety of coffee options are fresh baked. Seating is cramped. It feels more like a restaurant than a coffee shop.

Super packed inside and really tight with space.  The chairs and tables are super close to each other and no place to move where the sugar and water is at.  Tried the chocolate croissant and it wasn't buttery or flakey and we expected.  Also had the peanut butter cookie and it was too crunchy, I thought it would be at least a little soft inside, but no.  Kid had a chocolate milk and they obliged nicely when she asked for extra whip!  Sissy had a hot mint tea which are always over price, hot water and a tea bag?  I think these type of services should only be extra charged when they're the once actually brewing it, but whatever......I had the hot Mexican coffee and I guess I was expecting more Mexican chocolate flavor, or at least a stronger hint of cinnamon.  The sweets looked delicious, but because what we ordered was dull, I decided not to chance it further.  We parked right outside, but I can see how that could be a problem on a busy weekeday.  The outside is pretty cool, but definitely not an option in summer!
Great coffee!  Love the patio and indoor seating. Great foam art, as well. Does it get any better than this?
For an airport eatery, the price is not bad for their omelettes! I paid $8.50 and this omelette is humongous! Very happy customer!

Really enjoyed my Sunday morning visit to Lola's. Felt a bit intimidated as I've been waiting to come here for such a long time, but just have never had the time to make the trip down from El Mirage. 

The coffee is fantastic, and the pastries are top notch. I liked the vibe / atmosphere - in terms of coffee shops, that's always part and parcel of the overall experience. It's got to be a place where you can spend stress free time without feeling rushed or pushed out the door, and I think Lola's manages that well.The downside is that for good coffee / food, you pay for experience more than your typical coffee house. That said, it was totally worth it in my opinion. Lola's reminds me of the Wild Iris in Prescott, which is a very, very good thing :)

First off, the savory scones. The. Savory. Scones. They're what Red Lobster biscuits might be...maybe...if they were made with real ingredients and love. (My apologies to the baker for the RL biscuit comparison)

I come to Lola pretty often because I live in Willo. At first I came to Lola because the closest coffee spot, Roll Over Donuts, closed their Vernon & Central location. Now I come to Lola for the scones.

As soon as I spotted the savory scone with bacon and cheddar I had to try it. This is not your typical *cough...Starbu...ahem* scone. It is not a dense floury biscuit. 

The Lola scone is crispy on the outside and light, fluffy, and bursting with buttery flavor inside. I prefer their savory options, which change daily but often have yummy bits of cheddar throughout, because they taste like breakfast. Get it warmed up and enjoy it with a simple cup of coffee or am Americano. So damn good.
One of my favorite coffee shops.  Great neighborhood feel and superb coffee.  Small breakfast menu but tasty.  Wish their hours were more extended.

In comparison to Lux, I prefer Lola's much better! Lux is quite intimidating and confusing when you first walk and it's always full of "cool kids".  Not that I have a problem with them, but Lola Coffe Bar had people I could identify with--working adults like myself and I felt comfortable there. 
I had a cafe mocha with a chocolate croissant.  I went around 11am on a Tuesday, so it wasn't very busy. The baristas were nice and friendly,  and my order was ready in less than five minutes.  Overall, I had a great experience and will definitely come here often.

I love how adorable Lola is. It's the perfect hipster downtown Phoenix hang out spot. It's cute for a date, cute for office coffee runs, or cute for working out of the coffee shop! They have Wi-fi available and it can get pretty packed with worker bees throughout the day. Although the school desk furniture might not be super comfortable for a 5-hour work meeting marathon. Great coffee and LOTS of awesome (non-gluten-free, sigh) treats like cookies and brownies to satisfy your sugar cravings. The hot cocoa is to die for. The lattes are great, although their smalls are SO small! This is a great place, and a great parking garage to have in the middle of Phoenix.
Cute place great vibe. Coffee was okay. Great service. Love what they have going here and will be back for sure. I will just get something different than what I had the first time.
The best ever!  I will go out of my way to get coffee at Lola's.  The Cappuccino was perfect and my friends brewed coffee was very good.  We had cookies too; they were very tasty.

My friend and I were looking for a place where you could have good coffee and conversation.   We found Lola on yelp and decided to give it a try.  

We are so glad we Did!  We love the Cafe Mocha and Cafe Blanco!  Those 2 are the truth!

Lola isn't the coffee shop I visit most often (mostly because they don't stay open late) but they do have my favorite drink, The Matador. Often imitated, but never as good, The Matador is truly delicious. I wish they stayed open later than 7...it's such a bummer they don't.

Had to drive to downtown Phoenix for a week for work and decided to stop in and get an americano. I parked in the back and thought I smelled something on fire. As I walked to the back door that was wide open I noticed that they were roasting coffee beans. I have been to places that roast their own beans but never seen them doing it, so it was really cool to me. The decor was very nice, it seemed that they spent a lot of time tying to reuse things and be eco friendly which I like. The menu was a glass door with a wood frame, bolted to the wall and hand written, I thought it was very well done, and I enjoyed my americano as well!

We came across this place after walking from the Japanese Friendship Garden which is located down the street from this coffee shop. I really enjoyed my experience here due to the quality of the coffee that was being served and the friendliness of the staff. I always make it a habit to try community coffee shops when I travel vs. going to the generic place's like starbucks/coffee bean. The inside of the shop is a bit small with limited seating area but they offer a outdoor patio that is shared with other local business. Outside in the patio they have a water station with packets of sugar, straws, napkins, etc. Overall cute coffee shop with a great team.

This coffee is AMAZING and no I'm not exaggerating. 

Get the Matador coffee it is a creamy latte with different flavors. Free Wifi and the pastries are not delicious.

Lola's serves the best coffee in Phoenix. They roast their own beans and sell coffee beans as well as coffee drinks. The staff are friendly and efficient. The decor is cool and laid back. As an added bonus, I always run into friends at Lola's as its a popular meeting spot.

One of the best coffee shops downtown. Great atmosphere and wonderful staff. The brownies and banana bread are to die for as well as the caramel latte. Can't go wrong if you're looking to relax and enjoy your coffee. Great place for a quick date with friends. Wonderful patio in the back.
I drive far out of my way to come here.  Best coffee in Phoenix and BEST customer service. LOVE the ladies at Lola

Being a native Seattleite it's hard to find a similar coffee shop setting in the SW desert.  I was pleasantly suprised with Lolas.  Their lattes are great and the atmosphere is very chill.  Love that I will be living so close and can walk or ride my bike here.
Great little spot. Salted chocolate chip cookie a touch too! Nice place to go sit with your laptop and work. Good intimate atmosphere.

The Roosevelt neighborhood has got it going on. For a moment I felt I was not in Phoenix when I was walking around. I stepped into Lola Coffee  which is in a beautiful historic building with high ceiling and lots of natural light. Hooray historic preservation! Lola Coffee roasts their own beans, but other than that it's just a coffee shop, but a damn good one. It was clean, they had a wide selection of pastries and goodies, the employees were nice to me. I am a strict espresso/black coffee drinker and it packed a punch. Well done, bean roaster guy or gal! 
I loved the back patio as well. I wish I lived in this neighborhood so I could go to Lola more often.

Lovely service. They ran out of Yerba mate and Moroccan mint tea, but the girl recommended the vanilla which was very good.  The airport unfortunately doesn't allow them to have a tip jar. It's a shame, cause they were really nice.

Centrally located. Parking could be better. Delicious chai. I am a sipper and my chai was still good later in the day with some extra ice. This place was pretty crowded but had a short wait and was delicious.

Eh. It was good.

I tried to be really indulgently scientific on this one, getting the same stand-by I typically get at Lux (Iced honey soy half-caf latte... man, I am totally the girl with multi-syllabic drink orders. Younger me hates older me.). And, well, it just wasn't as good. Could have been the honey or the beans or any combination thereof. Cheaper though! By a bit. 

Eh. I'll drop by when downtown for sure but it's no Lux.
My husband and I like to try coffee shops on Sunday's and today we picked Lola's.  I think we found our spot!  The food is amazing and they don't skimp on the portions.  I would recommend this place!
I was in the area and was in dire need of caffeine. Did a quick yelp search and found this coffee shop. It's a cute coffee shop. I loved the coffee and would have loved to try some of their pastries.

Well we've been coming here a while. We even moved into the apartment next door and thought this would be our regular place. 
Then this morning we decided to try breakfast there. Mistake. After ordering a breakfast sandwich to go we sat and waited while plate after plate passed the handoff plane. One to-go order came up but it clearly wasn't mine.
After 15 minutes I decided to ask what was going on. Politely since I know accidents happen. The girl behind the bar told me I need to wait 10 minutes and they'll call my name. End. 
Now I'm hungry and peeved. So we wait longer. Another 15 minutes go by and I ask a different girl if my order fell through the cracks. She actually goes to check with the cook who has no recollection of my order at all and says someone else probably took it. 
She offers a refund, I decline saying I don't mind waiting if they make it right. She says it'll be done in 5 minutes. 
Another 15 minutes go by, (45 since I ordered) and a to-go item pops up in the window. I immediately check it out and ask if it's my breakfast sandwich. The cook tells me she's not sure what it is even though SHE just put it there. She asks my name and checks the tickets then explains she turned my sandwich into an omelet instead. 
I take it and we leave. 
Looks like we'll be finding a different place for local breakfast. I understand accidents happen but lack of communication and organization when dealing with people's food is just irresponsible.

This is an awesome little coffee shop right in downtown Phoenix.  Good coffee, comfortable seating, good ambiance and music, service is fine.  All of the things that you look for in a good coffee shop.  I will definitely be back and next time I will be trying the baked goods that looked really good!

Lola is good but very small inside and expensive. I enjoyed my coffee but I probably won't be back. Parking is also difficult and you either have to pay for parking at a meter or find a curb down the streets nearby.

I like Lola coffee a lot. They have been the most consistent with my drink order out of many coffee places. 

They have free parking and Ive almost always gotten a spot except once! 

They have great pastries and quiche to go with your coffee if it's either to go or if you are hanging out there are tables inside or outside. 

It's just a great place over all to sit, relax and enjoy downtown! (With the right cup of coffee)

The best breakfast burritos in the valley! No seriously the best in Arizona!! The coffee is heaven as well! Cute, tiny, intimate place to have some yummy coffee. Their pastries look delish, but was too busy with my bacon, egg, potatoes, and cheese burrito.

Lola is the best coffee downtown. I've only had better in San Fran... There coffee is consistently better than Jobot. Only thing it's a bit hard to hang out here there are always a bunch of people here. The people that come to Lola are more up class and young than any other shop I been to it's great spot to meet people! They roast their own coffee an it has a very clean taste. It has ample parking in the parking garage free wifi ask for the password.
I ordered a drip coffee. The coffee beans tasted burnt and like Folgers. Additionally, the volume of the store was loud; however, the outdoor seating is convenient.

Not the best choice for a coffee.... my cappuccino doesn't taste right.. I think Barista didn't care about it and my milk is cold in my cappuccino :-( I'm not coming back here.... I'll better to go to Cartel there are coffee is always excellent!!!

Typical rip off coffee place. My husband went to get my order and asked "is this for lindsey"? Short little blonde shrugged her shoulders and said I don't know, if that's what she ordered then take it.

Right... I absolutely LOVE bringing my husband to these artsy coffee places. He wears a backwards hat, has a huge beard, and wears regular clothes. Not the typical person to go to these places, leave a review, or even care. He has me write these things up and warn people of coffee shops that hire snobs. Had a sandwich. Half of the bread on the menu was a dollar up charge. They are make a killing off the local hundreds of college students in apartments around the area. They thrive off of location. They really don't care what us from Gilbert think. They will continue to make a killing unless you stop going.
Atmosphere was laid back inside and outside patio had lots of seating. I got the iced chai which was great and staff was friendly. I would go back here again.
This place was so nice! It's really charming and the drinks were delicious. The lattes were so creamy and smooth, I look forward to going back and trying more!

I've been plenty a time.

Pastries = Smashing.

Mocha = Delish.

Matador = Cinnamon Heaven.

I've never been without being greeted by a welcoming smile and amicable disposition by the staff, especially miss Lisa.
Meh. If you're looking to experience FRIENDS without the cast and with "mood lighting" go here.

Best coffee place downtown Phoenix, coming from a Portland transplant. I struggled for the longest time to find a decent city coffee place with a good ambiance. This place makes everything right from their coffees, to their food & simplistic, unassuming, inviting layout. Highly recommend.

Really good taste to their espresso, got a black americano and almost needed nothing to add to it. Pretty busy there in the morning but the baristas were quick and got everyone taken care of in no time. No complaints in regards to coffee and staff

It's hard to find a good latte in Phoenix. So we were thrilled to find good reviews on Yelp and happened to be in the area. As others have posted, he roasts beans on site. The barista happily reported that she had run out of beans earlier in the morning so we were enjoying beans that had just been roasted about an hour earlier. The cookies were yummy too.

The guy who owns Lola apparently started in Seattle with a shop by the same name, then came to Phoenix to start Lux. He then left Lux to open Lola.

LOVE their coffee...one of the best around! It has a great flavor and aroma, and is very smooth. I buy their beans, which is pretty decently priced, for my own brewing at home as a treat :) Their staff is friendly and helpful, and the atmosphere is cool and relaxed. It depends on the day and time you are there, but the couple of times I've been there it's always been very quiet, which can be a bit awkward to hold a conversation, since all the tables are pretty close together, and the shop is just one open room, so pretty much everyone can hear you if nobody else is talking. Otherwise, I love this place, and they have great pastries too!

I'm in love. Lola caf√© caramel love. The best coffee taste sensation is served up here with a smile. What is their secret to make this so smooth and creamy without any over-sugared taste, but with the caramel flavor hinting through perfectly? 

My breakfast also included the tortilla espanola, which was satisfyingly yummy with potatoes and eggs in the layers of goodness. It is offered warmed up or as is. I had it warmed.

Seriously cannot go wrong here! I will be back to experience their outdoor seating and more of their items.

Fortunately Lola is not convenient for my daily commute otherwise I would be here every morning and much poorer as a result. Best cappacino in town. I also like the small urban vibe. I wish Daniel would open another one uptown again. I miss the Central location, it was my Saturday morning habit for at least a year and the one that popped up at The Yard was awesome while I lasted.

I think I can die happy now. Literally the BEST vanilla soy latte I've had in a long time! I was really impressed with this latte lol. 

Decided to switch things up from my usual jobot latte and stopped by Lola and I am glad I did. Also ordered a breakfast burrito which was super delicious as well. this place does get pretty busy, but they are very fast. The staff is friendly, super fast, and helpful. Also they have a good sense of humor. 

So funny story my name is so complicated so when I order coffee or anything that requires my name I just say lani to simplify everything. And 90% of the time my name still gets butchered really bad. It has become a highlight on my daily snapchat story. The cashier that took my order wrote my name down "Gilani" she literally made my morning and my snapchat friends morning lol. That was probably the most glorious name butcher... 

Anyway a great place for some coffee for all my coffee addicts out there!!

Their cheese danish rocked my face a couple hours ago. Additionally, it was really early when I went in and thus my ability to properly pronounce "cafe au lait" was truly sad. However, the barista didn't flinch, took a guess, confirmed it with me, smiled, and in one fell swoop we were on the same page. Didnt make me feel unworthy or out of place like coffee shops sometimes do for not being able to pronounce things. Cool! Tasted great too
One of my favorite coffee shops downtown! Good location, cozy and cute environment both inside and outside. Staff is always very nice!
The decor was awesome, very trendy. The  coffee was delicious. Only downside was it was a little warm and for it being summer time in Arizona they should've cranked the A/C a bit more.
This is the best coffee shop in all the land!!!! The baristas make this place fun, inviting and familiar!
Really liked the environment, feels so cozy. The service is quick and friendly. The coffee is great! Will definitely be back.
Great little authentic spot for a relaxing cup of coffee or a quick little bite to eat. I will definitely be back very soon.

Tried the coffee. It's soo delicious. Think it's one of my favorite coffee shops in Phoenix. They play the best songs and I could sit by the window for hours studying, people watching or even dog watching =]
Try the Cafe Caramel and ask for their whip cream. Yum! Long-time favorite coffee spot for my sister and me.

Totally different vibe from Lux, which most in the valley know it's where all the cool kids are at. Sometimes, it's a bit too much for a Saturday where you just want to have a breather~

I came by for my daily dose of caffeination and a mini study sesh and loved how small and quiet Lola was! Simple menu, fresh made pastries, quick service and calm, quiet environment. Definitely no music blasting here, it's more of an acceptable background noise. Even the patrons were decently quiet and some stepped out to take their calls.

I just got a regular latte, no flavored syrup and no sugar for me. I wanted to taste their coffee and boy was it good! Not tangy or overly acidic and no burnt coffee beans, thank you! (I'm glaring at you Starbucks*) And boy, the caffeine kick in this small cup was awesome. I didn't grab a pastry, but saw the blueberry muffin/upside down cake sell out within the 1-2 hour stay of being there.

The staff is pretty quick and got to see regulars come in and conversate with the staff. Lola is pet friendly too! Tables along the wall, couch and chairs, as well as communal tables. Wish there were more outlets available, I saw only one during my visit underneath the large painting. If you're looking for a place not to be planted in front of your laptop, there's tables and seating out front and in the back- which is lovely if you're looking to bask in the sun and have a strong cup of coffee.

Definitely gonna come back to try their pastries and obviously more coffee!

I have been on a quest of trying all of the different local coffee shops in the CenPho area, so naturally, I had to try Lola. Upon entering, I loved the high ceilings and the historic feel of the place. I tend to like my coffee tall, dark, and well roasted. No sugar or cream for me, and Lola certainly served up a good cup. I really liked the atmosphere and the friendly staff too. As for food, the pastries looked yummy and I would certainly consider trying one next time. I will definitely keep Lola on the list to revisit in the future.

Very cute coffee shop, great decor. The latte was average and the coffee art was a mess. Still tasted pretty decent though. The espresso isn't as flavourful as at Lux. I'd give them another shot next time I'm in Phoenix, maybe the barista was having an off-day or something.

I love Lola's downtown and drive boku miles to get coffee there. The airport is a joke. Arrived today at 4:50am, all other coffee shops open and they were trying to figure it out. Ordered coffee and an omelette at 5. Said 5 minutes for omelet- ok, 25 minutes later no omelet and they complained when I asked for refund. Almost missed boarding because of it - it's the airport. Coffee was weak - I had a quad shot and just not that great - their espresso shots were so long they were running over the side. Downtown on Roosevelt is amazing. This place is great to look at but lacking in quality and service.
Love Lola coffee. Place is great, staff is fantastic. Would give 5 stars if they opened at 6:30 instead of 7:00.

Such a convenient and cute little coffee shop. It's right down the street from my office so my coworkers and I love to go in and we know most of the employees. They're all usually very nice and the service is great and quick. Delicious tea and coffee too!

It's clear that this place is a popular shop, it was crowded and a little loud when we visited this Friday morning. Seating is limited inside however we were able to find a spot outside, and thankfully they had umbrellas over them. They have a selection of baked goods (cookie & blueberry scone were very good) as well as sandwiches to order and of course, coffee. If I lived here it probably wouldn't be my personal favorite coffee shop but I can definitely see why many like it!

Great atmosphere, very casually hip.  A front counter looking out the front window over Roosevelt provides good views and people watching.  One couch and two armchairs and a smattering of other tables completes this small coffee shop.  Good music and good coffee.  Not too loud and typically not too busy, although internet can be slow.  They also have pretty good pastries if you're looking to get a snack to go with your caffeinated beverage.  Calmer than Lux but more hip than Giant.

Amazing coffee, and the cookies and pastries are great.
This place is awesome, if you can find parking nearby of course. Try one of the side streets near the apartment buildings, there is usually parking around there.

But once you get over that whole mini crisis, come into lola's.. sit down and have an amazing cup of coffee. It was great to sit by the window and just chat. It is small and cozy and just what you need for a great chilling afternoon

I had other reviews about this coffee shop, and a lady building suggested that we stop by to grab a cup of coffee.  
 

And you know I'm glad that we checked this place out. Yes, it is full of hipsters, but that's something that  can be overlooked.. Furthermore, make sure to check out their baked goods that are absolute heaven and are made in house. 

 
 

Lola my dear you are a breath of much-needed fresh air.

I've been a repeat customer off and on over the years.  The matador is my favorite, but I like the iced version better than the hot.  But the cafe blanco is soooo good hot!  

They are decently quick and friendly even when its busy.  Parking can be no fun at times, but on not busy times, there is a lot of parking avail in the garage!

Good coffee, but TERRIBLE customer service!!!

The workers are slow and lazy and spend more time chatting with other employees rather than taking time for customers.

Where is the management???

Great coffee, setting and food! Lots of indoor and out back seating. I got a sandwich and boyfriend got a burrito. Both were good! Sandwich was too big for me to finish (not a bad thing). Also the blueberry muffin was so good. We definitely will be back! I wish there were more tables out front. And also if there was a table with the breakfast order forms were I think it would keep things rolling. This was our first time ordering breakfast so we didn't realize we had to fill it out at the counter, which took time deciding what we wanted and then we had to get back in line again.

I just moved back down to Phoenix from Seattle. This place is pretty good!!! I got a large Carmel Latte. It was very smooth and brought me right back to sitting on pioneer square in downtown Seattle. The employees were very friendly here as well.
Love this place, I ordered Matador coffee here and just wanted to chill with my husband for a while. Nice place, only one think I wish they have more outlets.

Best coffee I've ever drank! They are at the top of the list! Like just in Arizona in the US! I've traveled all over the United States drinking coffee. And I must say I'm a Lola lover! Lol also I make my own coffee at home as well and I buy their beans. Not just that but their prices are fair 4.25$ for a large latte. If you haven't already tried them and love coffee you have to walk into this place at least once

I come in here atleast once a week since it is on my way to work now. 
There was even a week that I came in every day.
Twice on one day.
Ok, ok! Three times! I COULDN'T HELP IT! Don't judge me.
I usually get either the Matador or the Cafe Caramel. I try to avoid the homemade espresso whipped cream like the plague but usually fail because it is ssoooo delicious. So delicious infact that I spell "so" with two S's and four O's.
What I do succeed at is not buying an entire plate of whatever flavor short bread cookies they have that day Those are even better than the whipped cream, but as they charge for the cookies and not the whipped cream, I have to exhibit a little self control. I have a little better self control when my money is involved (but not much).
Their poppy seed and strawberry muffins are amazing as is their quiche, but it's their short bread cookies that are life altering. Ok that may be a slight exaggeration, but I suspect it's laced with something addictive because I think about them ALL the time.
I love the decore here. I want one of their (what I assume to be reclaimed) wood tables in my apartment. I also am in love with the work of the artist on exhibit this month.
Usually I just look, but this time I might actually buy a piece or two. Really. 
So now that I write this, I sit at work staring at the clock waiting for my time to go home so I can stop by for a drink and cookie. This is going to be the slowest afternoon. Ever.
Oh and Nathan S., you better start checking in more. Your Dukedom is at stake and I want it!

A-OK for a latte. The service was nice, and my latte arrived in a timely fashion. Not much different than any other major coffee chain - except one thing...

This, my dear friends, is a service industry. As such, I totally expect, and enjoy, tipping my barista whatever extra amount that is reasonable.

However, there was no tip jar. I find this disconcerting because it usually points to a micro-managing supervisor or some authoritarian policy that disallows hard working people who very likely make close to minimum wage from getting ahead.

What's the deal, Lola? You should allow customers who wish to tip their hard working barista and other staff if they want to. Owners and management must be real jerks.

To the staff who work here - I sure hope the management catches up to 2017 and allows customers like me who have worked in this industry before to tip you for your hard work!

I've been to Lola Coffee a number of times and have tried several other local coffee bars in the area and Lola Coffee beats them all hands down. They roast their own beans and if you are an Americano lover, like myself, you won't find a better one around. 

The service is great and the barista's are friendly. 

The only drawback is it's so small to be so popular! 8-)

I am a Starbucks SNOB. I do love to support local coffee shops but I absolutely have been a Starbucks fanatic forever. I gave Lola a try after a late lunch @ Pita Jungle. I was so impressed. I told the barista I was a vegan and she was able to veganise my white chocolate coffee (I think that was the name) by using different ingredients. AWESOME. I then went back a few days later and had the caramel coffee, delish! So good! I no longer have a craving for Starbucks, like at all!
Great coffee and good sweets. The barista could be a bit more personable and less of a 'what do you want and please don't ask questions' personality.
The cafe blanco with homemade whip is the best drink ever! The atmosphere is a bit crowded but the coffee is worth it.

I love love love this place. I often treat myself a couple times a week to a coffee and danish. All the pastries are hadnmade in house and are the BEST you will ever taste. I could seriously eat a DOZEN of their cream cheese danishes in one sitting. 

I can't attest to a variety of coffees there because I always get the same thing; a drip coffee with a shot of vanilla. That alone is saying something because I typically prefer the usual fru-fru coffee. But their coffee is good enough that I don't see the need to jazz it up more than some simple vanilla and cream. The beans are all roasted in-house as well, nice touch, you can taste the difference. 

The atmosphere is hip. Its definitely no franchised Starbucks, and I love that. All around, I would go to Lola everyday if I could afford it! Alas, their prices are pretty much on-par with the rest of the nicer coffee shops. 

Stop in, get a cream cheese danish, and order yourself something where you can actually taste the coffee still.. Kick back and enjoy the ambiance.

Every time I think about this place I think about all the great music the Kinks played!
I loved their music and I love this coffee house.
The coffee is served exactly the way you want it and it tastes perfect.
The people who are there seem to understand the world.
The food offerings are wonderful and our group ate two different breakfast yummies-one of which had a decidedly Mexican flavor.
Parking can be difficult and the inside seating capacity is limited but the coffee experience is worth all the petty inconveniences.
Go for Lola and go for gold.

Good soy latte, bad blueberry scone. Latte was smooth & had the perfect combo of soy milk. The blueberry scone was dry and lacked flavor.  Also wasn't a fan of the sugar on top, graininess is never a good taste.

Coffee is great, good place to read or study. Just wish it were open longer at night and on weekends. Perhaps having the Pita Jungle open next door will increase foot traffic and thus demand. 

Free wifi.
soursdey! hip environment with Indy rock music, wifi included. chill hangout. bottled water limited to spring water. had the iced chai after a bit of walking and I'm refreshed!

A coffee shop with great ambiance and skillful baristas. However, coffee is only as good as the beans and their beans are horrific. Although the texture of my flat white was perfect, the taste was so harsh as if the only note I could sense was carbon.

This place is so good. I love their huge art piece and it's a very homey vibe. It doesn't try too hard in terms of vibe, but it's very stylish and warm.

I had the iced mocha and after all the mochas I've had in California and Canada and even PNW in the last few months theirs was seriously so good and I actually could taste a significant difference between everything I've had. 

YUM. 

Also, we used street parking so, meters.

What I like abt Lola Coffee:
There are plenty of tables to sit at. If it gets too chilly inside bc of the a/c, you can sit at one of the many tables outside. There's free street parking and you can park in the gold parking garage right behind the coffee shop. It's brightly lit indoors. Lola coffee is next to a Pita Jungle and Painting Lounge.

10 out of 10! Fabulous coffee, great pastries and friendly service. If you're looking for a great espresso based drink and just enough hipster vibe, this is your place. They have a Lira espresso machine and their coffee beans are very well roasted (not burnt, not over roasted and not too floral/fruity). Baristas and cashiers were all friendly in the week I was here.

I love this place. It makes my weekly commute to downtown Phoenix something I look forward to. Excellent coffee. I can't get enough of the blueberry muffins or scones - such a hard decision that I often get one of each. :-)
