The service is great, friendly and very speedy. Often my coffee is ready before I finish picking out my treat and paying. Which is super helpful when you have to get to work.
Awesome group of ladies serving up great coffee. Amazing space and nice chill coffee shop vibe.

I liked the food. I had a vegetarian burrito with a chai. I like the location and aesthetics.  The person attended me could have been friendlier, I thought.  It seemed that my basic questions about the menu (it was my first time here) were a nuisance. I sat in the patio to enjoy my food. I would have enjoyed my experience if the customers were more ethnically diverse, though.

Lola is beautiful. It's been through my high school and college days and continues to be in my life post grad. Always lovely. Staff is kind and the people usually are too. 
There's parking in the structure right behind it!! Kind of confusing if you have never been. 
Their iced coffees are refreshing and the area is usually good for studying or working. I recommend weekday afternoons for work, weekends are a little crammed.¬†¬†
Patio is cute. Worth a visit !!! 

Don't recommend going to the alterations place right by it if that catches your attention like it did mine... lol really over priced and grumpy owner
Cute little coffee shop in town. Very nice patio in the back to sit outside. The banana bread was great!

Just when I thought I wouldn't find a coffee shop that wasn't a Starbucks, I saw the swirly letters of Lola beckoning to me like elegant, welcoming fingers. I just knew that there would be caffeinated delights waiting for me behind the glass door!

I haven't had an iced coffee since October. It's been a long, cold winter here in KC and for me, this means copious amounts of hot coffee. Being that in Phoenix it was in the 70s, I was happy to be able to have the taste of spring in an iced Americano with two raw sugars. They make a damn good cup here, plus the barista is super nice, even when inundated with non drip coffee orders. 

I had to take it to go, but I loved the cozy, rustic environment.  There's one large communal white wooden table, and then a bunch of smaller wood tables throughout the shop with metal chairs that conjure up images of a 1930s school house. When I was there the last week of January, they had a mesmerizing photography exhibit, with several enormous prints that I'm not going to even try explaining (I uploaded several pics). 

I have a strong feeling if I lived in Phoenix, this would be my go-to coffee shop for work, meetings, or just hanging out. And of course, getting that perfect cup to go.

Calling all coffee connoisseur's!! My tastebuds are out of control! I ordered the Iced Matador (with Whip Cream...get the whip cream) and oh my gosh was it delicious!! Everything about it was great from the perfectly roasted coffee with cinnamon flavor (very subtle) to the homemade whip cream! Delicious! customer service was nice, although they weren't very friendly (not the typical super welcoming, "let's have a 20 minute conversation" vibe). The entire space is basically one giant room with a huge patio in the back. Inside, the tables + chairs and couches are in a very tight space but once sitting down I didn't even notice how many seats were in this room as it didn't bother me as much as it did when I first walked in. This place is a little nosier than most coffee shops in the area, but not to the point where getting work done or having a conversation is un-bearable!

I would highly, highly, HIGHLY recommend Lola to any coffee freak/connoisseur!!

My husband is from Raglan, NZ and he said Lola's had the best lattes he has ever had! My mocha was delicious too :) chocolate didn't over power the coffee.

If you get there early, they usually have banana bread or zucchini bread that tastes yummy.

I've been recently obsessed with checking out cute and trendy coffee shops in the downtown area and found Lola Coffee. Love the yellow walls and my latte and donut were perfect! The area outside is super cute for taking pictures and enjoying that caffeine fix! Love it
Great coffee and amazing service.  This is the epicenter of Phoenix coffee culture!  Indeed the best of Phoenix.

Somewhere that can actually make proper foam not only out of regular milk but soy milk! Very good granola and Amish pastry. Definitely will be back in my next passing through of Phoenix! Great customer service as well.

Service is always welcoming.  Lucky to have a neighborhood cafe that serves your coffee with a smile and a "Thank you".

Favorite Drink is The Matador and you absolutely can't skip the whipped cream.

Pastries never an intention when I go in but always draw my eye and I'm sold.  They never disappoint

I really like this atmosphere. Great looking art work to blend in with the feel of atmosphere. I tried the mocha and it tasted good. The customer service was good and friendly. This is a decent coffee shop and I would recommend it.

SO I went by this place with my dad after lunch today on my coffee tour of Phoenix!!! (ftw). This place is walking distance from my dad's office, so it was perfect as far as location goes. The inside is really nice, I like the decor and I think it feels comfortable. I got a latte and my dad got an iced mocha with whipped cream. Well they make their own whipped cream and it was really good! It has a little bit of chocolate and coffee in it. Yum. My latte was good, but was more milky than coffee -y. The espresso was a little weak. Overall, it was a really good cup of coffee though, and it ranks up there with the good coffee shops of phoenix. I would definitely go back. Also, they have the cutest pastries! they have little tarts and mini cupcakes and it all looks really good, but I didn't try one today because I had just eaten lunch. The prices were fair I thought. Overall, good place.

THE BEST ICED MOCHAS!!! HANDS DOWN! I'm an iced mocha fan and I'm always on the hunt for the most delicious well-bodied iced treat. I don't like when my mochas are sickly sweet and artificial tasting like Starbucks. I don't like when my mochas taste burned or over milky.... 

But Lola has it down! There is something so divinely wonderful about their iced mochas. A perfect balance of chocolate, coffee, and sweet. The best part is their home made whip cream which is truly heavenly.
Nice little coffee house. Historic bldg, industrial/funky relaxed atmosphere. Americano superb. Thumbs up

Had my first Matador the other day and thought it pretty much rocked 

Unlike its sister shop on Central, this Lola keeps it simple with good coffee served by friendly staffers who spin vinyl at a reasonable volume. Reliable Wi-Fi, too.

This location is ideal for catching up with an old friend or relaxing with a magazine.
Best hot chocolate and breakfast quiche! Love the patio area. I would definitely come back!

This is my favorite coffee shop downtown! They have the best combination of bold and mild beans. The coffee is always delicious hot or cold. The baristas know your order and are always friendly. The pastries are also fresh and yummy! I love Lola's coffee shop.

I had the matador.  It. Was. Bomb.  When the barista asks if you want whipped cream say yes.  Its like this, when you are going to pay $4 for coffee it better be good.  

The atmosphere is hipster, but not like they're trying too hard.  It's a nice place to hangout, or if the weather permits, walk around the neighborhood.  It's pretty.  

The only downside is that if you're not walking here, parking can be a challenge.

Okay GREAT coffee and whipped cream is home made. Honestly, I was blown away by the customer service. Both baristas (male and female) were SO NICE and friendly. I feel like it's really rare to have friendly staff at a coffee shop in Phoenix. The place was super clean and both employees were either cleaning or stocking stuff the whole time. I can really appreciate this because customer service is about 75% of my experience. Love this place and the friendly people here. I will definitely be coming here instead of the other popular coffee shops in the area.

Lola Coffee was yet another stop in my quest to find my favorite coffee shop in downtown Phoenix. Lola stands out for its large patio behind the building, dog friendliness, and plethora of breakfast options and baked goods. I've tried the scone and the Spanish tortilla. The Spanish tortilla is packed with potatoes and comes with a delicious aioli. It's probably my favorite coffee shop breakfast I've tried downtown. The coffee is strong and the iced lattes are smooth. It can feel a bit cramped inside, but there's plenty of seating outside. I'd come here for a drink to go, or to chat with friends, not so much for working.
I love this place so much that you can find me here every weekend at some point. It's amazing!

The staff is friendly, the place is cute, there is a nice patio, everything is high quality, but the espresso just doesn't have a strong enough flavor for me. I'll have to come back and try a few more things, like the Matador everyone raves about, and that homemade whipped cream.
Oh no!  I should have updated this long, long ago.  Turns out I've been back.  (Reluctantly, I'd

A great place to meet around downtown where you can actually get both a good cup of coffee and free parking! Went here to get some work done, and it was a little noisy in the late morning. It calmed down for a bit, but picked back up around lunchtime. I enjoyed my cafe au lait, and I was tempted by the baked goods but resisted (this time). I will have to go back again soon!

Service was just ok, my iced coffee spilled all over and was given to me that way. Little things like this make want to not come back. There are tons of coffee places in Phoenix, why bother returning to a place that does not care much for presentation or a friendly staff.

Friendly service (with some fellow geocachers as baristas!), comfortable couches, and rich, creamy coffee.  I had the cafe au lait (pronounced "oh-lay" and not "ow-lot" for my fellow plebs), which had such great flavor that I didn't need to add any sugar.  Ask for it served in the "for here" cups!  If the weather is good (which it is often in Phoenix), you can sit outside on the back porch and enjoy the warmth.  Lola Coffee has some of the best-tasting coffee I've found yet in Phoenix.  The food offerings are also pretty strong; instead of just serving up sugary pastries, Lola has quiche and tortilla espanola, which is a potato-and-veggie-filled quiche-like dish.  I had a cup of coffee and breakfast at Lola's the other day before work, and it was a great way to wake up and begin my day.  5/5 stars from me!

A surprising discovery at the Sky Harbor Airport! Took a friend to the airport, walked with her to the gate and realized there was still time before she had to go through security. That's when the aroma of coffee both hit us. Looked around and found Lola Coffee.

Doesn't have that burnt, over-roasted coffee flavor like some self-proclaimed coffee Star offers. Anyone with a sweet tooth will DEFINITELY like this!  I had the Caf√© Blanco and it was delicious!

Places with outlets to plug in a laptop for work and comfy chairs for relaxing. Service was great too. I will admit: there weren't many people around when we stopped. Might get crazy during traditional air travel hours.

Not a five-star 'cause we didn't order a meal or pastry (yeah, difficult to imagine that, but we were both full from lunch. I had a salad, which was shocking for both of us).

This will be my coffee fix anytime I'm at the airport.

Before today, I would have rated this place a 2 or a 3.  I'm not a HUGE fan of their coffee, and their internet always seemed to be extremely slow (even when there were only 2 of us in there).  But, their pastries were always great, especially the shortbread.
I'm from Portland, so I can be pretty picky about my coffee.  Today was not an exception either.  The coffee had way too much of an acidic taste, like they pulled the shot and let it sit there or something.  The reason I gave it 4 stars today is their internet is blazing fast with about 10 laptops out.  I haven't had an issue yet.  And I can always get the iced tea...

This place seems to be everything you'd want in your neighborhood coffee joint. I've only been once and I had an iced mocha (yeah, that's right). The coffee was delicious and to top it off, literally, the whipped cream (yeah, that's right) was infused with espresso. 

The atmosphere caters to the downtown hipster, wifi set. Which is smart 'cause if you've got fast throughput and good joe they'll lurk and linger in droves, doling our ducats all the while. It probably rates a five star review but I just did a hit and run.
great place to just relax have some peace and quiet and best of all enjoy an amazing lattee and awesome snacks that they have. Great selection and great quality would recommend this place to anyone

The service was great and the espresso laced whip cream was yummy but they failed to stock more food for us hungry travelers. No flat bread and she was unable to make cheese omlets. Plus, the quiche had pork. Bummer!

This place is a total gem in downtown Phoenix. The coffee is STRONG and wonderful and the food (croissants, doughnuts, muffins, etc) tastes like what I had back in New York. 

The space is bright and open - the exact type of place I want to hang out on a Sunday morning.

Meh, the iced green tea was refreshing, and husband reports the coffee was "fine", but as a person who likes to park and play at coffee shops this spot was unmemorable and a bit cramped. Probs better for grab and go type coffee adventures, otherwise everyone can see all the weird shit you're shopping on Amazon for.
Decided to stop by Lolas after we were unsuccessful in navigating to a nonexistent juice bar, cozy little place but not too many options besides coffee lover stuff. . . #TEAMTEA

Came here after my flight to get some ice tea. First off if you are gonna me open 24/7 as they say then you should also have things in stock. They didn't have the iced green or black tea available. They made the hot green tea to pour it over ice, but didn't wait for it to brew. Now pretty much all I have is warm water. The only reason I even gave it any higher than 1 star is because the guy behind me decided to buy my drink.

1st Time here and already love it! As soon as you walk in you walk into a coffee oasis!! The smell is so strong and Delicious it just makes you love coffee even more. I got their dirty chai and it tasted pretty good. The espresso shots in there had a bold taste which I love! There's lots of seating space so it's awesome to come and hang out. The crowd of people it attracts is pretty cool. Definitely my kind of vibe.
